resources.title: 100 Selected Short Stories
resources.author: O'Henry
resources.maySub: A different compilation of O'Henry's short stories.
resources.rationale: Known for his brilliant play of words, his wit, and unexpected endings, author O. Henry's short stories have an essential place in 20th-century American literature.

resources.title: 100 Things to See in the Night Sky
resources.author: Dean Regas
resources.maySub: 100 Things to See in the Southern Sky, if in the southern hemisphere.
resources.rationale: Astronomy Field Studies
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting.

resources.title: 101 American Geo-Sites You've Gotta See
resources.author: Albert Dickas
resources.maySub: Aerial Geology by Mary Caperton Morton
resources.rationale: Geographical survey of geological sites of interest, includes a well-written geological analysis on each site and excellent coverage across regions of the U.S.  Canadian learners may prefer Aerial Geology.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting.

resources.title: 1493 for Young People
resources.author: Charles Mann, Adapted by Rebecca Stefoff
resources.rationale: This book helps students understand both the positive and negative effects that resulted from the Columbian Exchange (the exchange of goods and people between the Old World and the New World during the Age of Exploration) in the 15th century. This thought-provoking book gets past the facts of history to explore the ideas that still affect us today.
resources.note: Make sure to buy the Young Reader's Version. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: 1493: Uncovering the New World Columbus Created
resources.author: Charles Mann
resources.rationale: The story of globalization starting in the 15th century.
resources.note: This book is used in several rotations and is a more advanced version of the book in Grade 9. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: 150 American Folk Songs to Sing, Read, and Play
resources.author: Peter Erdei (editor), Katalin Komolos (composer)
resources.rationale: Good collection of American folk songs for younger children. Includes some games and sol-fa notes.

resources.title: 1919: The Year That Changed America
resources.author: Martin W. Sandler
resources.rationale: A resource that focuses on pivotal events from the year 1919 and traces their impact of them on the future.
resources.note: Do NOT confuse this text with the controversial 1619 Project.

resources.title: 2081 (Short film)
resources.author: Chander Tuttle
resources.rationale: A modern short film depicting the story of Harrison Bergeron.
resources.note: Video-YouTube

resources.title: 303 Kid-Approved Exercises and Active Games
resources.author: Kimberly Wechsler
resources.rationale: The younger version of the tween exercise book used in grades 4-8.

resources.title: 303 Tween-Approved Exercises and Active Games
resources.author: Kimberly Wechsler
resources.rationale: This book provides a great list of exercises that includes strength training, flexibility exercises, and cardiovascular activities. This can be used in a group or with one student.

resources.title: 5-Minute Sketching Series
resources.author: Various Authors
resources.rationale: An ideal introduction to a rewarding pastime and a source of inspiration for new, experienced, and lapsed sketchers alike.

resources.title: 50 Adventures in the 50 States
resources.author: Kate Siber
resources.rationale: This beautifully illustrated book provides a two-page spread for each state and shows what activities can be done based on the geographical features of the area. This book will be used alongside Cross Country to follow the Page family as they travel across the country.

resources.title: 50 Buildings You Should Know
resources.author: Isabel Kuhl
resources.rationale: This book is used for several history rotations to study some of the fascinating buildings of the time period.

resources.title: A Boy Called Slow
resources.author: Joseph Bruchac
resources.rationale: A young Lakota Sioux boy comes of age and earns the name "Sitting Bull."
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: A Boys and Girls Life of Christ
resources.author: J Paterson Smyth
resources.rationale: Experience a vivid retelling of the life of Christ, rich with detail, that makes the reader feel like an eyewitness to a series of events with a guide at his side. This guide places each scene in its geographical context, describes the people Jesus encounters, and connects one scene to another in chronological sequence. All this background will help the reader begin to form a mental map of the significant locations in Jesus’s life, fix in his mind the people who figure prominently in the narrative and the nature of their relationship with Jesus, and the chain of events in His ministry beginning with the calling of the disciples and leading to the Passion, Resurrection, and Ascension.

resources.title: A Brief History of the World in 47 Borders: Surprising Stories Behind the Lines on Our Maps
resources.author: John Elledge

resources.title: A Castle with Many Rooms
resources.author: Lorene Lambert
resources.rationale: This history spine covers important events and influential people from the Middle Ages. Students will get a feel for what life was like then in Europe, Africa, the Americas, the Middle East and Asia.

resources.title: A Castle with Many Rooms Narration Cards
resources.author: Crystal Hildreth
resources.rationale: This set contains excellent narration prompts for children of various ages and levels. Assignments in our lesson plans will often refer you to them.

resources.title: A Child's First Book of Prayers
resources.author: Lois Rock

resources.title: A Child's Introduction to the Orchestra
resources.author: Wilder & Barer
resources.rationale: Creative introduction to each instrument of the orchestra through song.
resources.note: Unavailable for purchase.

resources.title: A Christmas Carol
resources.author: Charles Dickens
resources.maySub: Cricket on the Hearth, Great Expectations, or Hard Times
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: A Field Guide to Bacteria
resources.author: Betsy Dexter Dyer
resources.rationale: A fascinating look at the world of bacteria.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: A Free Woman on God's Earth
resources.author: Jana Laiz & Ann-Elizabeth Barnes
resources.rationale: This is the story of Elizabeth "Mumbet" Freeman, the enslaved African woman who had the courage and conviction to speak what was in her heart, suing for her freedom in a Massachusetts court of law.

resources.title: A Fruit is a Suitcase for Seeds
resources.author: Jean Richards
resources.maySub: any life-giving picture book about seeds as preferred by the teacher.
resources.rationale: This beautiful picture book introduces students to the ways that plants use seeds. It is a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: A God Entranced Vision of All Things: The Legacy of Jonathan Edwards
resources.author: John Piper (editor), Justin Taylor (editor), Stephen J. Nichols (contributor), Noël Piper (contributor)

resources.title: A History of Canada in Ten Maps: Epic Stories of Charting a Mysterious Land
resources.author: Adam Shoalts
resources.rationale: This book tells the story of the discovery and development of the land that would become Canada by exploring the creation and usage of ten significant maps. It is an innovative and engaging approach to Canadian history, written by an academic and modern-day adventurer who has followed many of the routes taken by the explorers he includes in this book. It shows how history writing can create a more vivid representation of the past when it draws on biography, story-telling, geography, and cartography.
resources.note: This book will be used over two years in high school.

resources.title: A History of the American People
resources.author: Paul Johnson

resources.title: A History of the World in 100 Objects
resources.author: Neil MacGregor
resources.rationale: Helpful reference to use as a resource for Book of Centuries.

resources.title: A History of US: From Colonies to Country
resources.author: Joy Hakim

resources.title: A History of US: Liberty for All?: 1820-1860
resources.author: Joy Hakim
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: A History of US: The First Americans
resources.author: Joy Hakim
resources.rationale: This is a great spine to explore pre-Columbian history in the Americas through 1600. The author spends several chapters discussing the various native tribes that lived throughout the country. She helps students understand the context of Europe that brought explorers, treasure-seekers, Catholic missionaries, and new settlers to America.  Her engaging writing style and use of photos and maps will help students understand this time period.
resources.note: Canadian students will also be using this book since it covers the history of the Americas and ends in 1600 before the Jamestown Colony.

resources.title: A House Spider's Life
resources.author: John Himmelman
resources.maySub: any life-giving picture book about spiders as preferred by the teacher.
resources.rationale: This beautiful picture book illuminates the life of a common, but often less appreciated, creature. It is a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.

resources.title: A Kick in the Head: An Everyday Guide to Poetic Forms
resources.author: Paul B. Janeczko
resources.rationale: This engaging book of poetry introduces readers to twenty-nine poetic forms with examples from classic and modern poets.

resources.title: A Land Divided
resources.author: John F. Hayes
resources.rationale: This Governor General's Award-winning novel is an exciting, adventurous tale about two cousins who get caught up in the French-English conflict of 1755 which would eventually lead to the tragic Acadian expulsion. This fast-paced novel features a sailing adventure, a daring rescue, and a spy plot, but on a deeper level, it shows how the line between the two sides was often drawn straight through families, as both cousins have an English and a French parent.
resources.note: The version used in this course is the recent edition which has been updated and abridged by Donna Ward.

resources.title: A Library for Juana
resources.author: Pat Mora
resources.rationale: This is a delightful picture book biography about the life of Sor Juana Inés de la Cruz and her love for books. Sor Juana, sometimes known as the "Mexican Shakespeare," wrote during the time of Anne Bradstreet and others at the end of the 17th century.
resources.note: Option 2 link is a Spanish edition.

resources.title: A Little Book for New Historians
resources.author: Robert Tracy McKenzie
resources.rationale: Robert Tracy McKenzie offers a concise, clear, and beautifully written introduction to the study of history.  Loaded with concrete examples and insightful principles, this primer shows how the study of history, faithfully pursued, can shape your heart as well as your mind.
resources.note: Also highly recommended as a resource for parents and teachers.

resources.title: A Long Obedience in the Same Direction: Discipleship in an Instant Society
resources.author: Eugene Peterson
resources.rationale: Noted Bible scholar, Eugene Peterson, shares insight on a guided study through the Psalms of Ascent.

resources.title: A Manual of Clay-Modelling
resources.author: Hermione Unwin
resources.rationale: This book includes projects that teach students to create three-dimensional art.
resources.note: Video tutorials are provided with lesson plans.

resources.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
resources.author: William Shakespeare
resources.rationale: One of Shakespeare’s most popular plays, A Midsummer Night’s Dream is a comedy set in Greece during the 12th century. The magical setting of this play is the city of Athens and the nearby enchanted woods where fairies and their mischief reign in the moonlight.
resources.note: This is a good play for those who are newer to Shakespeare.

resources.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording.
resources.rationale: Hearing a play being performed often helps students with comprehension. These professional recordings are superb.

resources.title: A Museum of Early American Tools
resources.author: Eric Sloane

resources.title: A Parcel of Patterns
resources.author: Jill Paton Walsh
resources.rationale: This historical fiction novel that takes place in the 1660’s is based on true events and people from the town of Eyam, a small town in rural England. The narrator uses the language and register of her time to portray the effects of the plague and what their town did to help stop the spread of it.

resources.title: A Peterson Field Guide To Western Trees
resources.author: Olivia Petrides
resources.rationale: Regional guide
resources.note: Choose a Tree Finder or comparable guide for your area.

resources.title: A Planet of Viruses
resources.author: Carl Zimmer
resources.rationale: This is an especially relevant book for today.
resources.note:
Choose this book OR Microbe Hunters.

Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting and Audible.

resources.title: A Poem for Every Day of the Year
resources.author: Allie Esiri
resources.rationale: While students enjoy more historical poetry in these grades, this delightful anthology adds variety and spice to their diets to make sure they don't forget to simply enjoy the sights and sounds of words and the curious ways poets can communicate silly and serious truths. Poems from across the centuries are featured and come with a short introductory note to whet students' appetites.

resources.title: A Poem for Peter: The Story of Ezra Jack Keats and the Creation of The Snowy Day
resources.author: Andrea Davis Pinkney (author), Steve Johnson & Lou Fancher (illustrators)

resources.title: A Poem to Read Aloud Every Day of the Year
resources.author: Liz Ison

resources.title: A Revolution in Color
resources.author: Jane Kamensky
resources.rationale: For students who want to dive into Copley and his world further, this book gives an interesting picture of the social history of the Revolutionary period. It also helps students to understand the beginning of the art world in America and who Copley was in the greater scheme of things.

resources.title: A Short History of Ancient Rome
resources.author: Pascal Hughes

resources.title: A Short History of the Twentieth Century
resources.author: John Lukacs

resources.title: A Short History of the United States
resources.author: Robert Remini
resources.note: Used across Forms 4-6 for multiple rotations. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: A Short Life of Jonathan Edwards
resources.author: George M. Marsden
resources.rationale: Jonathan Edwards is one of the most extraordinary figures in American history. Arguably the most brilliant theologian ever born on American soil, Edwards (1703–1758) was also a pastor, a renowned preacher, a missionary to the Native Americans, a biographer, a college president, a philosopher, a loving husband, and the father of eleven children.

resources.title: A Single Shard
resources.author: Linda Sue Park
resources.rationale: This book grows students' love for literature and history by immersing them in the life and riveting story of Tree-ear, an orphan boy in a 12th-century Korean potters’ village. Great for Book of Centuries work as well.

resources.title: A Spy Called James: The True Story of James Lafayette, Revolutionary War Double Agent
resources.author: Anne Rockwell
resources.rationale: James spied for George Washington to help America gain its freedom. But can he gain his own?

resources.title: A Stolen Life
resources.author: Jane Curry
resources.rationale: The year is 1758. Lively Jamesina's three older brothers, who are with the British Army in America, and her father and youngest brother, living in exile in France, have left her in the care of her relatives in their clan's homeland in the Western Highlands of Scotland. Yet danger reaches her even there. She is snatched from the shore by "spiriters," men who kidnap children and young people to sell to planters and farmers in America as bond slaves. She wakes to find herself a prisoner on board the Sparrowhawk, bound for Virginia

resources.title: A Tale of Two Cities
resources.author: Charles Dickens
resources.rationale: Charles Dickens' famous novel set during the French Revolution.

resources.title: A Thousand-Mile Walk to the Gulf
resources.author: John Muir

resources.title: A Voice of Her Own
resources.author: Kathryn Lasky
resources.rationale: Kidnapped from her home in Africa and shipped to America, a girl was purchased by the Wheatley family in Boston in 1761. She’d had everything taken from her, but Phillis Wheatley had a passion to learn. Amid the tumult of the Revolutionary War, she became a poet and ultimately had a book of verse published, establishing herself as the first African American woman poet. Although her poems are challenging for young students, Kathryn Lasky's short biography introduces them to this remarkable woman.

resources.title: A Walk in Paris
resources.author: Salvatore Rubbino
resources.rationale: Even though the text is in English, students will focus on the lively illustrations that beautifully capture the delight of a young visitor experiencing the wonders of Paris. In this book, a young girl and her grandpa explore Paris’s iconic landmarks and experience its culture and style firsthand. This book is a great way to learn French vocabulary during the picture study lessons.

resources.title: A Walk in the...
resources.author: Rebecca L. Johnson
resources.maySub: any life-giving picture book preferred by the teacher that is about a biome (one that is familiar for Term 1; one that is not for Term 3).
resources.rationale: These beautiful picture books take us on a walk through the biomes, introducing the various plants and animals we might encounter in various seasons. They are a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.
resources.note: Links provide various options in this biome book series. Teachers should select one that is familiar to the student for Term 1 and one that will be less familiar for Term 3.

resources.title: A Walking Tour of the Gospels
resources.author: John A. Beck
resources.rationale: The author** **guides students to a greater understanding of the places Jesus walked, taught and performed his miracles. Through short descriptions of the places, color photos, and maps, this book will give students a better sense of the geography of the land of Israel and, therefore, help them understand the Bible better. It is a great complement to the study of the gospel of Mark.

resources.title: A Wonder Book for Girls and Boys
resources.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
resources.rationale: Nathaniel Hawthorne is a master storyteller. This collection of stories from Greek mythology is a great introduction for young children.
resources.note: Grade 3 students should read EITHER Pilgrim's Progress OR A Wonder Book.

resources.title: A World in a Drop of Water: Exploring with a Microscope
resources.author: Alvin and Virginia Silverstein
resources.rationale: This book introduces students to the microscopic creatures that live in natural water. They will examine pond water under a microscope to see the hidden lives of single-celled organisms.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting.

resources.title: A World of Poetry: Student Book
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.rationale: This volume helps students understand the elements of poetry that poets use to create meaning and beautiful language. Poetic devices are examined through the reading of classic and modern poems.
resources.note: You do not need to purchase the Teacher's Manual. We will provide extra support and answers to the exercises in the lesson plans.

resources.title: A Year in the Maine Woods
resources.author: Bernd Heinrich

links.url: Join the Christmas Bird Count and/or the Great Backyard Bird Count! Look up common bird songs! Songbirds of America

resources.title: A Young Patriot: The American Revolution as Experienced by One Boy
resources.author: Jim Murphy
resources.rationale: This book is based on the true account of Joseph Plumb Martin, a Connecticut farm boy who enlisted in the army in 1776. Students will witness first hand what life was like for a soldier during the Revolutionary War.

resources.title: Abraham Lincoln and Frederick Douglass: The Story Behind and American Friendship
resources.author: Russell Freedman
resources.rationale: A close look at this relationship which brings the backdrop of the times to light.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Acadian Driftwood: One Family and the Great Expulsion
resources.author: Tyler LeBlanc
resources.rationale: A work of creative non-fiction that is both personal and expansive in its scope, _Acadian Driftwood_ recounts the Acadian Expulsion of 1755 through the experiences of the Leblanc family, which included ten siblings and their parents. The author is a descendant of this family, and only discovered his Acadian ancestry once he began to do genealogical research as an adult. This book makes an excellent history spine as it weaves the diverse fates of the family members into the larger conflicts, events, and developments of the latter-half of the eighteenth century.
resources.note: Option 2 link is for those purchasing from Canada.

resources.title: Across Five Aprils
resources.author: Irene Hunt
resources.rationale: This is a gripping story about a family that is torn between the Union and Confederate causes--a common experience during the time. As relatives take up arms on opposing sides, the ones left behind can only wonder if such a fracture can ever heal.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Across the Blue Pacific: A World War II Story
resources.author: Louise Borden
resources.rationale: This picture book about World World II is told from the perspective of a young girl whose neighbor is in the Navy and serving his country in the South Atlantic. It provides a glimpse of how young people strived to make sense of a war so far away and how they supported the soldiers who were fighting bravely.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

resources.title: Across This Land
resources.author: John C Hudson
resources.maySub: 1st edition but some information--especially regarding natural resources--will be out of date.
resources.rationale: This book provides a narrative regional study of North America for our high school students.
resources.note: Used across multiple years. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Adelita
resources.author: Tomie dePaola
resources.rationale: Mexican Cinderella Story

resources.title: Advanced Academic Writing II Teacher Manual
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.rationale: _Advanced Academic Writing II_ helps students learn the basics of source integration, literary analysis, academic style, and the writing process. Only the teacher manual is required as it includes the full text of the student book plus special boxes that contain extra tips and questions that students and instructors will reference.

resources.title: Adventures with a Microscope
resources.author: Richard Headstrom
resources.rationale: Activity book: a guide to seeing Things with your microscope

resources.title: Aerial Geology
resources.author: Mary Caperton Morton
resources.rationale: This is an up-in-the-sky exploration of North America’s 100 most spectacular geological formations.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting.

resources.title: Aesop's Favorite Fables
resources.author: Aesop, illus. by Milo Winter
resources.maySub: another collection of Aesop's Fables. Lesson plans include the story titles.
resources.rationale: Aesop's Fables have made learning life's lessons enjoyable for 2500 years. The illustrations by Milo Winter set this collection apart.

resources.title: Africa and Middle East Geopuzzle Game
resources.author: Geotoys

resources.title: African American Poetry: 250 Years of Struggle & Song
resources.author: Kevin Young

resources.title: Alexander Hamilton, Revolutionary
resources.author: Martha Brockenbrough
resources.rationale: Discover this founding father's incredible true story: his brilliant scholarship and military career; his groundbreaking and enduring policy, which shapes American government today; his salacious and scandalous personal life; his heartrending end.

resources.title: Algebra 2/Trig Ancillary Materials
resources.author: Math Without Borders
resources.rationale: Solutions manual for Algebra 2/Trig

resources.title: Algebra and Trigonometry: Functions and Applications
resources.author: Paul Foerster
resources.maySub: earlier edition or online course with derekowens.com.
resources.rationale: A master teacher guides you through the next level of algebra and trig.
resources.note: Choose this or Denison.

resources.title: All in a Drop: How Antony van Leeuwenhoek Discovered an Invisible World
resources.author: Lori Alexander

resources.title: All Over the Map: A Cartographic Odyssey
resources.author: Betsy Mason & Greg Miller
resources.rationale: A collection of amazing maps covering a wide range of topics.  Students will be inspired to make maps of their own.
resources.note: Used over several years.

resources.title: Alveary Biology Lab Book
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This document contains all of the instructions, procedures, and guidance needed to complete the laboratory component of High School Biology.
resources.note: Relevant supplies from the Grade 10 list are further detailed in the Table of Contents for the Lab Book. It is recommended that supplies are obtained either for the year or by term.

resources.title: Alveary Chemistry Lab Book
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This document contains all of the instructions, procedures, and guidance needed to complete the laboratory component of High School Chemistry.
resources.note: Relevant supplies from the Grade 9 list are further detailed in the Table of Contents for the Lab Book. It is recommended that supplies are obtained either for the year or by term.

resources.title: Alveary Exclusive Cambridge Latin Unit 1 Online Course
resources.author: Angela Reed
resources.rationale: Video lessons taught by a master teacher.
resources.note:
Students receive a year of access from the time they login to the course on our online platform.

Materials needed: Student book

resources.title: Alveary Exclusive Cambridge Latin Unit 2 Online Course
resources.author: Angela Reed
resources.rationale: Video course taught by a master teacher in our Alveary course platform.
resources.note:
Students will receive a year of access to our online platform starting Aug 1st, and lessons will be released throughout the year. Click the link for details on the course calendar, samples, and more.

Materials needed: Student book

resources.title: Amazing Grace (movie)
resources.author: Michael Apted (director)
resources.rationale: Story of William Wilberforce (includes an appearance of Equiano, John Newton, and other characters you'll know)!

resources.title: Amazing Grace: William Wilberforce and the Heroic Campaign to End Slavery
resources.author: Eric Metaxas

resources.title: Amelia Bedelia Books
resources.author: Herman Parish
resources.rationale: Amelia is a maid who takes everything literally. This leads to very funny situations.

resources.title: America - Heart of a Nation
resources.author: Diana Waring
resources.rationale: Learn history by listening to the songs of America's heritage and enjoy short, accompanying stories.

resources.title: America Grows Up
resources.author: Gerald W. Johnson
resources.rationale: This trilogy gives an overview of American History from Columbus through the 1960s. Johnson's ability to zoom out and articulate the overarching ideas of the time and the significance of events is an important contribution to the study of history.

resources.title: America Is Born
resources.author: Gerald W. Johnson
resources.rationale: This trilogy gives an overview of American History from Columbus through the 1960s. Johnson's ability to zoom out and articulate the overarching ideas of the time and the significance of events is an important contribution to the study of history.

resources.title: America Is Under Attack
resources.author: Don Brown
resources.rationale: This picture book recounts the events of 9/11 and highlights a few heroes who were not afraid to go into harm's way.

resources.title: America: Our Stories (Vol. 1)
resources.author: Lorene Lambert
resources.rationale: This book provides a bird's eye view of American history and brings early American history to life through masterful storytelling, photographs, and reproductions of historical paintings.

resources.title: American Catholic History: A Documentary Reader
resources.author: Massa (ed.)
resources.rationale: A collection of primary source documents and essays reflecting on distinctly American Catholic experience from the 16th century to the present day.

resources.title: American Colonial History: Clashing Cultures and Faiths
resources.author: Thomas Kidd
resources.rationale: Thomas Kidd, a widely respected scholar of colonial history, deftly offers both depth and breadth in this accessible, introductory text on the American Colonial era.

resources.title: American Literature
resources.author: William Long
resources.rationale: A helpful chronological look at American Literature and authors.
resources.note: Selections used across multiple rotations.

resources.title: American National Writers: Irving, Simms, Kennedy, Harper, Hawthorne, Harte, Twain
resources.author: Various Writers
resources.note: PDFs included in the Lesson plans.

resources.title: American Tall Tales
resources.author: Mary Pope Osborne
resources.rationale: These larger-than-life stories capture something of America's personality. Mary Pope Osborne has retold these stories well, and the wood-carved illustrations are delightful.
resources.note: U.S. Student Option. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Amo's Sapotawan
resources.author: William Dumas
resources.rationale: _Amo's Sapotawan_ is a beautifully illustrated story of a Rocky Cree girl, Amo, and her sapotawan, which means a rite of passage, as she chooses the path for her life. This book combines an engaging story with sidebars that explain traditional practices and cultural information in greater detail; the end result is a richly historical integration of narrative and nonfiction, where Amo's personal story teaches readers about Indigenous life in the seventeenth century. Yet, this is also a universal story of how a young teenager, with support from her community, works to discover where her skills and gifts lie.

resources.title: Amos Fortune, Free Man
resources.author: Elizabeth Yates
resources.rationale: When Amos Fortune was only fifteen years old, he was captured by slave traders and brought to Massachusetts, where he was sold at auction. Although his freedom had been taken, Amos never lost his dignity and courage. For 45 years, Amos worked as a slave and dreamed of freedom. And, at age 60, he finally began to see those dreams come true.

resources.title: An Age of Science and Revolutions
An Age of Voyages
resources.author: Merry E. Wiesner-Hanks
resources.rationale: This is a well-written and engaging book that is supported by wonderful illustrations and primary sources. The author does a great job of bringing to life a time of great changes in civilizations around the world. This book covers 1350-1600—the time of the plague, renaissance, exploration, turmoil in the church, and powerful empires around the globe.

resources.title: An American Plague: The True and Terrifying Story of the Yellow Fever Epidemic of 1793
resources.author: Jim Murphy
resources.rationale: A familiar topic but from the 18th century.

resources.title: An Honorable Heritage: The Pandita Ramabai Story in Her Own Words
resources.author: Pandita Ramabai
resources.note: Use option one link to receive discount.

resources.title: An Illustrated Treasury of Hans Christian Andersen's Fairy Tales
resources.author: Hans Christian Andersen
resources.rationale: More fairy tale readings. Check local library for picture book versions of these Grimm or Andersen tales. There are often multiple versions to read and compare to the anthology version.

resources.title: Ancient Empires: From Mesopotamia to the Rise of Islam
resources.author: Eric H. Cline & Mark W. Graham
resources.rationale: Ancient Empires is a relatively brief yet comprehensive and even-handed overview of the ancient Near East, the Mediterranean, and Europe, including the Greco-Roman world, Late Antiquity, and the early Muslim period.
resources.note: Used for several rotations.

resources.title: Animal, Vegetable, Miracle: Our Year of Seasonal Eating
resources.author: Barbara Kingsolver, Steven Hopp, Camille Kingsolver, & Lily Kingsolver

resources.title: Ann Judson: A Missionary Life for Burma
resources.author: Sharon James

resources.title: Anna of Byzantium
resources.author: Tracy Barrett
resources.rationale: A gripping saga of alliances, intrigues, deceits, and treacheries about Anna Comnena, a Greek princess and historian of the Byzantine Empire.

resources.title: Annals of the Former World
resources.author: John McPhee
resources.rationale: Like the terrain it covers, _Annals of the Former World_ tells a multilayered tale, and the reader may choose one of many paths through it. This is a long book, which students may or may not finish, depending on interest.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting and Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Anselm of Canterbury
resources.author: Simonetta Carr
resources.rationale: Anselm is probably the greatest theologian who lived during the time between Augustine of Hippo and Thomas Aquinas. His writings have had a great influence on the Christian church, and his teachings about the relation between faith and reason are a vital part of the historical Christian confessions. This biography with wonderful illustrations is written for younger students to come to know this great man of faith.
resources.note: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read over the year.

resources.title: Answering the Cry for Freedom
resources.author: Gretchen Woelfle
resources.rationale: This book contains short biographical sketches of black patriots who helped America win its independence.

resources.title: Archimedes and the Door of Science
resources.author: Jeanne Bendick
resources.rationale: Students will love this funny and informative biography of Archimedes, one of the first inventors of record.

resources.title: Aristotle for Everybody
resources.author: Mortimer J. Adler
resources.rationale: Mortimer J. Adler presents the ideas of Aristotle in a thoughtful, clear way.

resources.title: Armstrong: the Adventurous Journey of a Mouse to the Moon
resources.author: Torben Kuhlmann

resources.title: Around the World in 80 Tales
resources.author: Saviour Pirotta
resources.rationale: This book takes readers across six continents with short, entertaining folktales to stir our first graders' imaginations with tales from many lands.

resources.title: Around the World in Eighty Days
resources.author: Jules Verne
resources.rationale: This story captures the pervading spirit of the Victorian age and offers opportunity to discuss ideas such as excitement over technological advances, the pride of colonialism, and the worship of science and empiricism.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Art Print Set
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This art print set contains high-resolution images that are in the public domain or used for Alveary with permission. We recommend printing on cardstock. Hard copies will be available with lesson plans.
resources.note: Selections are also included in Our Work packets for Grades 1-12.

resources.title: Art Print Set
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This art print set contains high-resolution images that are in the public domain or used for Alveary with permission. We recommend printing on cardstock. Hard copies will be available with lesson plans.
resources.note: Selections are also included in Our Work packets for Grades 1-12.

resources.title: As You Like It (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording

resources.title: Ashes
resources.author: Laurie Halse Anderson
resources.rationale: As the Revolutionary War rages on, Isabel and Curzon have narrowly escaped Valley Forge—but their relief is short-lived. Before long they are reported as runaways, and the awful Bellingham is determined to track them down. With purpose and faith, Isabel and Curzon march on, fiercely determined to find Isabel’s little sister Ruth, who is enslaved in a Southern state—where bounty hunters are thick as flies.

resources.title: Assassination and Its Aftermath: How a Photograph Reassured a Shocked Nation
resources.author: Don Nardo
resources.rationale: Photographic history of John F. Kennedy's assassination and the smooth and orderly transition of power to Lyndon B. Johnson.

resources.title: At Ellis Island: A History in Many Voices
resources.author: Louise Peacock
resources.rationale: This picture book is written in the voice of Sera, an Armenian girl from the early 1900s who is traveling to America in the early 1900s to meet her father at Ellis Island. Other vignettes throughout the book give descriptions of the journey of immigrants from various countries who left their homeland to find a new life in America.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

resources.title: At the Back of the North Wind (Everyman's Library Edition)
resources.author: George MacDonald
resources.rationale: In this Victorian fairy tale, MacDonald explores the themes of social injustice and the role of death in our lives. This edition includes the original illustrations.

resources.title: Atomic Habits
resources.author: James Clear
resources.rationale: James Clear, one of the world's leading experts on habit formation, reveals practical strategies that will teach you exactly how to form good habits, break bad ones, and master the tiny behaviors that lead to remarkable results. This book brings Mason's thoughts on habits into the 21st century applying current research in this field.
resources.note: Choose this OR Think

resources.title: Back from the Brink
resources.author: Nancy F. Castaldo
resources.rationale: Also available on Kindle.

resources.title: Baking Class
resources.author: Deanna Cook
resources.rationale: This book teaches the secrets of great baking, using kid-friendly directions and recipes.

resources.title: Bandoola: The Great Elephant Rescue
resources.author: William Grill
resources.rationale: With wonderful illustrations and interesting text, this book tells how elephants were instrumental in helping refugees leave Burma (Myanmar) and travel to India during WW2. It is a great way to explore the culture and geographical features of these parts of Asia.

resources.title: Barracoon
resources.author: Zora Hurston
resources.rationale: This book serves to widen students' understanding of the Atlantic slave trade using source documentation from an African perspective.

resources.title: Basin and Range
resources.author: John McPhee
resources.rationale: McPhee is a master of geological literature, and this book is the first part of his larger work Annals of the World.

resources.title: Bat Loves the Night
resources.author: Nicola Davies
resources.maySub: any life-giving picture book about bats as preferred by the teacher.
resources.rationale: This beautiful picture book illuminates the life of a common but less-often-observed creature. It is a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.

resources.title: Bats: An Illustrated Guide to All Species
resources.author: Marianne Taylor

resources.title: Be Confident: Live By Faith, Not by Sight
resources.author: Warren Wiersbe
resources.maySub: Experiencing the Presence of God by A. W. Tozer or a different commentary from your faith tradition.
resources.rationale: Wiersbe's approachable "Be Series" Bible study and commentary on Hebrews.
resources.note: Choose Wiersbe and/or Tozer.

resources.title: Be Encouraged: God Can Turn Your Trials into Triumphs
resources.author: Warren Wiersbe
resources.maySub: a different commentary from your faith tradition.
resources.rationale: Wiersbe's approachable "Be Series" Bible study and commentary on 2 Corinthians.

resources.title: Be Expert with Map and Compass
resources.author: Bjorn Kjellstrom

resources.title: Be Ready: Living in Light of Christ's Return
resources.author: Warren Wiersbe
resources.maySub: a different commentary from your faith tradition.
resources.rationale: Wiersbe's approachable "Be Series" Bible study and commentary on 1 & 2 Thessalonians.

resources.title: Be Rich: Gaining the Things That Money Can't Buy
resources.author: Warren Wiersbe
resources.maySub: a different commentary from your faith tradition.
resources.rationale: Wiersbe's approachable "Be Series" Bible study and commentary on Ephesians.

resources.title: Be Right: How to Be Right with God, Yourself, and Others
resources.author: Warren Wiersbe
resources.maySub: a different commentary from your faith tradition.
resources.rationale: Wiersbe's approachable "Be Series" Bible study and commentary on Romans.

resources.title: Be Thou My Vision: A Liturgy for Daily Worship
resources.author: Jonathan Gibson
resources.rationale:
➜ May sub Book of Common Prayer OR Phyllis Tickle's series: The Divine Hours
Helpful for establishing daily practices of reading and prayer.

resources.title: Be Wise: Discerning the Difference Between Man's Knowledge and God's Wisdom
resources.author: Warren Wiersbe
resources.maySub: a different commentary from your faith tradition.
resources.rationale: Wiersbe's approachable "Be Series" Bible study and commentary on 1 Corinthians.

resources.title: Beautiful Stories from Shakespeare
resources.author: Edith Nesbit
resources.rationale: Retellings of plays that can be used as a teacher resource or read to students who are new to Shakespeare.

resources.title: Bees
resources.author: Laura Marsh/National Geographic
resources.rationale: Also available on Kindle.

resources.title: Beetle Busters
resources.author: Loree Griffin Burns
resources.rationale: The Asian longhorned beetle has devastated forest ecosystems in America. Students are introduced to basic forestry as they learn about the problem of invasive species. The author beautifully invites the reader to consider the challenges of dealing with this complex issue and encourages dialogue and collaboration as part of the problem-solving process.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting and Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Before Columbus: The Americas of 1491
resources.author: Charles C. Mann
resources.rationale: A book based on 1491: New Revelations of the Americas Before Columbus, the groundbreaking bestseller by Charles C. Mann.

resources.title: Before Music: Where Instruments Come From
resources.author: Annette Bay Pimentel (author), Madison Safer (illustrator)

resources.title: Beginnings: Stories of Canada's Past
resources.author: Ann Walsh
resources.rationale: This first half of this book includes stories about the time period this course covers, however it does use outdated language and stereotypes.

resources.title: Behind Rebel Lines: The Incredible Story of Emma Edmonds, Civil War Spy
resources.author: Seymour Reit
resources.rationale: In 1861 President Lincoln made an impassioned plea for volunteers. Determined not to remain on the sidelines, Emma Edmonds cropped her hair, donned men’s clothing, and enlisted in the Union Army. Posing in turn as a slave, peddler, washerwoman, and fop, Emma became a cunning master of disguise, risking discovery and death at every turn.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Being God's Image: Why Creation Still Matters
resources.author: Carmen Joy Imes
resources.rationale: Carmen Joy Imes seeks to recover the theologically rich message of the creation narratives starting in the book of Genesis as they illuminate what it means to be human.

resources.title: Belisarius: The First Shall Be Last
resources.author: Paola Belzoni

resources.title: Belle's Journey: An Osprey Takes Flight
resources.author: Rob Bierregaard

resources.title: Ben and Me: An Astonishing Life of Benjamin Franklin by His Good Mouse Amos
resources.author: Robert Lawson
resources.rationale: Written from the point of view of a mouse who lived in Franklin's home, this book shows Franklin's many accomplishments, including printing, inventions, signing the Declaration, and his time in France.

resources.title: Benjamin Franklin
resources.author: Ingri D'Aulaire
resources.rationale: Learn about the life and times of Benjamin Franklin in this beautifully illustrated, classic children's book.

resources.title: Benjamin Franklin: A Nonfiction Companion to Magic Tree House #32: To the Future, Ben Franklin!
resources.author: Mary Pope Osborne
resources.rationale: A nonfiction companion to "To the Future, Ben Franklin!' Learn facts life, jobs, inventions, and more.

resources.title: Beowulf: An Illustrated Edition translated
resources.author: Seamus Heaney
resources.rationale: One of the earliest English texts, Beowulf is the epic tale of the Scandinavian hero who saves the Danes from the monster Grendel. This translation and edition is readable, linguistically rich, and includes illustrations and pictures of artifacts that students can use for their Book of Centuries.
resources.note: An audiobook is also available from Audible

resources.title: Bird by Bird
resources.author: Anne Lamott
resources.rationale: Classic book on the writing process. Be prepared for a few instances of adult content.

resources.title: Birds, Nests, and Eggs
resources.author: Mel Boring
resources.rationale: Activity book: take along guide

resources.title: Bitter and Sweet: A Journey into Easter
resources.author: Tsh Oxenreider
resources.rationale:
May sub Biola Advent & Lent Project.
Starting on Ash Wednesday and leading you all the way through Holy Week, Bitter and Sweet is an invitation to better understand Jesus’ sacrifice as you delight in His ultimate love for you.

resources.title: Black Heroes of the American Revolution
resources.author: Burke Davis
resources.rationale: Read about Crispus Attucks and other black heroes who are frequently overlooked in American History books.

resources.title: Black Ships Before Troy: The Story of 'The Iliad'
resources.author: Rosemary Sutcliff
resources.rationale: Sutcliff tells the story of the Trojan War with delightful literary style.
resources.note: The Option 1 link goes to an affordable paperback version of this book, and the Option 2 link features a lovely hardback version with beautiful illustrations. Lesson plans will refer to page numbers from the paperback but include chapter titles and start/stop text so that you are free to choose the version that works for you.

resources.title: Blake: Poems (Everyman's Library)
resources.author: William Blake
resources.rationale: Contains poems from Songs of Innocence, Songs of Experience, The Prophetic Books, and more.
resources.note: Poems are often listed directly in the lesson plans and are widely available online.

resources.title: Blood and Iron: The Rise and Fall of the German Empire
resources.author: Katja Hoyer

resources.title: Body into Balance: An Herbal Guide to Holistic Self-Care
resources.author: Maria Groves

resources.title: Bold Journey: West with Lewis and Clark
resources.author: Charles Bohner
resources.rationale: Drawing on journal entries and grounded in fact, Charles Bohner’s story re-creates the Lewis and Clark expedition from the experience of Hugh McNeal, one of the youngest members on the journey.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Born !: A Foal, Five Kittens and Confederation
resources.author: Deirdre Kessler

resources.title: Botany in a Day
resources.author: Thomas Elpel
resources.rationale: A patterned approach to learning the plant families.

resources.title: Botticelli
resources.author: Barbara Deimling
resources.rationale: This essential introduction presents the key works from Botticelli’s collection of paintings to understand the making of a Renaissance legend.
resources.note: OPTIONAL Teacher resource for Grades 1-6.  Assigned readings are included in the lessons for Grades 7-12.

resources.title: Breaker Boys: How a Photograph Helped End Child Labor
resources.author: Michael Burgan
resources.rationale: Lewis Hine documents working conditions and child labor in the early 20th century.

resources.title: Breaking Bread with the Dead
resources.author: Alan Jacobs
resources.rationale: A gifted scholar draws us into close and sympathetic engagement with texts from across the ages.

resources.title: Breaking Free: The Story of William Kurelek
resources.author: May Ebbitt Cutler
resources.rationale: Born in the Prairies in 1927, William Kurelek’s art exemplifies the joy and challenges of Canada in the mid-1900s. In this biography, students will follow Kurelek from Alberta to England to Ontario as they learn about agriculture, immigration, and the life of Christians in Canada. The landscape of Canada in the 1900s is vividly depicted through Kurelek's art and illustrations.
resources.note: Only available used, but you should be able to find used copies or find it at your local library.

resources.title: Brunelleschi’s Dome
resources.author: Ross King
resources.rationale: This is the story of how a Renaissance genius bent men, materials, and the very forces of nature to build an architectural wonder we continue to marvel at today.  We meet the everyday people of the times involved in the process.

resources.title: Brush Drawing as Applied to Natural Forms and Common Objects
resources.author: May Mallam
resources.rationale: This is a complete guide to learning how to brush-draw. Exercises progress from simple lines to monochromatic value painting to painting in color. Techniques taught help students learn to "see" so that they can visually represent their observations.

resources.title: Brushwork: Elementary Brush-Forms
resources.author: Marion Hudson
resources.rationale: This book is perfect for those who are new to brush drawing. The exercises on gridded paper help students learn to mix colors and control the brush. Brushforms ("blobs") are used to create designs.

resources.title: Bryson's Dictionary of Troublesome Words: A Writer's Guide to Getting It Right
resources.author: Bill Bryson
resources.rationale: A helpful resource for avoiding error and increasing clarity in composition.

resources.title: Buffalo Woman
resources.author: Paul Goble
resources.rationale: A young hunter draws his bow against a buffalo cow drinking from a stream. Before he can loose his arrow, there is no buffalo -- instead, there stands a beautiful young woman, whom he knows he must marry.

resources.title: Building the Canadian Nation (1953 or 1958 edition)
resources.author: George Brown
resources.rationale: Building the Canadian Nation gives students a historic background for our civil liberties and roots our parliamentary process in its British roots.

resources.title: Bulfinch's Medieval Mythology
resources.author: Thomas Bulfinch
resources.rationale: This volume is the section on English mythology from Thomas Bulfinch's classic anthology.

resources.title: Bullies and Saints
resources.author: John Dickson
resources.rationale: Bullies and Saints is a sobering and hopeful book that provides a brief overview of the church, especially leading up to and through medieval times.  Dickson is a competent and thought-provoking guide.  The book provides perspective and promotes humility as we wrestle with the actions of those in the church across all ages.
resources.note:
Chapter 23 discusses the sensitive topic of child sexual abuse in the modern church.  Alerts will be included in the lesson plans to direct students to their teachers for prereading, guidance, and discussion.

If you prefer to continue with the books read last year, read:  
_Church History in Plain Language_ (T1: p.173-214, T2: p.215-233, T3: 235-290)
_The Catholic Church Through the Ages_ (T1: p.92-171, T2: p.172-212, T3: 212-249)

resources.title: Butterfly Kit with voucher for larvae
resources.author: Home Science Tools
resources.rationale: Be sure to consider the temperature before redeeming your voucher.

resources.title: Buzztail and Leaper
resources.author: Robert M. McClung
resources.rationale: Two stories in one, this classic presents two very different animals in the context of their ecosystems. Students read about their habitats, biomes, food chains, life cycles, adaptations, and more.

resources.title: C.S. Lewis at War: The Dramatic Story Behind Mere Christianity (Radio Theatre)
resources.author: C.S. Lewis and Paul McCusker

resources.title: Caesar's English II
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.rationale: Studies in Latin stems, alongside typical classical and academic vocabulary words, will aid students in using, spelling and understanding these words in context.
resources.note: We strongly recommend the print version of this book since it has extra resources which are sometimes mentioned in the lesson plans, but you can choose paperback or ebook, black & white or color.

resources.title: Calico Captive
resources.author: Elizabeth George Speare
resources.rationale: This book, loosely based on a real diary, tells the story of Miriam, who finds herself captured by Native Americans during the French and Indian War. She is taken to Montreal, where she meets the prominent Du Quesne family. It is a coming of age story chosen for its captivating storytelling and ability to pique students' curiosity about other times and places.

resources.title: Call It Courage
resources.author: Armstrong Sperry
resources.rationale: A Polynesian boy who faces his fears of the sea.

resources.title: Calling the Doves
resources.author: Juan Felipe Herrera
resources.rationale: Used for picture study. This bilingual memoir portrays the author's memories of a life lived outdoors as part of a loving Mexican migrant family.

resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: Contains answers to selected exercises in the Student Book.  The answer key is not needed if Elevate is used.

resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: Contains answers to selected exercises in the Student Book.

[cambridgeelevatehelp.cambridge.org/hc/en-gb/requests/ne](https://cambridgeelevatehelp.cambridge.org/hc/en-gb/requests/new)w

resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: This is the student book. Includes a selection of original texts by Roman authors (adapted where necessary), including Catullus, Ovid, Pliny, Tacitus, and Virgil.
resources.note: This edition comes with 1-year access to Elevate/Cambridge Go.

resources.note: Please call the Cambridge University Press Customer Service team at 1-800-872-7423 (toll-free). or email them at orders@cambridge.org to purchase a digital copy.

resources.rationale: Site contains free cultural background information. Elevate/Cambridge Go is a subscription service for online games and practice.
resources.note: The student book we link includes 1-year access to Elevate/Cambridge Go.

resources.title: Cambridge Latin Units 1-4 Teacher Manual (1 Year Digital Access)
resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: Contains important teaching tips.
resources.note: Students using Unit 1 Companion course by Alveary do not need this book. Please call the Cambridge University Press Customer Service team at 1-800-872-7423 (toll-free) or email them at usschools@cambridge.org to purchase. There is also a 4 Year Digital Access option with ISBN 9781316640524.

resources.title: Can You Hear It? (Book & CD)
resources.author: William Lach
resources.rationale: Famous art paired with accessible classical music; notes interesting features of the music to listen for and begins with an introduction to various instruments of the orchestra.

resources.title: Can't You Make Them Behave, King George?
resources.author: Jean Fritz
resources.rationale: A short, entertaining biography of King George III.

resources.title: Canada Wild: Animals Found Nowhere Else on Earth
resources.author: Maria Birmingham
resources.rationale: This colourful, illustrated guide to Canada's endemic species introduces young readers to twelve special animals that can only be found in Canada and who have much to teach us about the varied ecosystems that make up our country.

resources.title: Canadian Fairy Tales
resources.author: Eva Martin
resources.rationale: A collection of stories drawn from British, French, and Irish traditions.

resources.title: Canadian Student Atlas
resources.author: Collins Maps
resources.maySub: other atlas; however, map work and other lessons refer specifically to this one.
resources.rationale: Used across the curriculum as a reference and as a text to read in some lessons. With interesting information and pictures, this is an economical reference for students.
resources.note: For Canadian students only. Optional for Grade 1.

resources.title: Canadian Wall Map (CA students only)
resources.author: National Geographic
resources.maySub: any Canadian wall map that shows both geographical features and place names. Avoid maps with roadways, as these obscure other features.
resources.rationale: This map clearly shows landforms, and its projection is more accurate than some other maps.
resources.note: Hang map at student eye level.

resources.title: Canva for Students
resources.rationale: Popular design software to introduce students to graphic design and visual thinking with technology.

resources.title: Caring for a Colony: The Story of Jeanne Mance
resources.author: Joanna Emery
resources.rationale: This is a story of pioneering courage and compassion in the New World. Jeanne dreamed of devoting her life to caring for others. In 1641, she courageously gave up her comfortable middle-class life in France to journey to the French colonies, today’s province of Quebec.
resources.note: Choose ONE Biography

resources.title: Caring for Words in a Culture of Lies (2nd ed.)
resources.author: Marilyn McEntyre
resources.rationale: Thoughtful and relevant ideas on writing for today's students.

resources.title: Carry On, Mr. Bowditch
resources.author: Jean Lee Latham
resources.rationale: The story follows the voyage adventures of Nathaniel Bowditch, a late 18th-century mathematician, astronomer, and sailor. We will study the locations along his voyage route, including the East Indies, Europe, the Philippines, and Sumatra, all starting on the American East Coast.

resources.title: Carver: A Life in Poems
resources.author: Marilyn Nelson
resources.rationale: This is not a book of poetry BY George Washington Carver; rather, it is a biography in poems. This makes the book a type of historical poetry, because it is about someone important who lived during the time period.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Castle
resources.author: David Macaulay
resources.rationale: In this Caldecott Honor Book, the author explores the history and construction of castles. As he traces the step-by-step planning and construction of both castle and town, students get a feel for life in the Middle Ages and the architectural knowledge that created these grand structures.

resources.title: Cathedral
resources.author: David Macaulay
resources.maySub: the black and white version but the text and page numbers vary from the color version.
resources.rationale: Through the use of perspective and dramatic points of view, this book draws readers into the process of building a cathedral. Although it is based on fictional people in a town in Europe, it captures the process of constructing a cathedral and the important features that make up these beautiful churches. This is a color version with new images.

resources.title: Cathedrals of the World
resources.author: John Green
resources.rationale: Even though this is a coloring book, it will be used as a resource to study the different features of cathedrals around the world.

resources.title: Cato: A Tragedy
resources.author: Joseph Addison
resources.rationale: Tragedy written by Addison in 1712 about Cato and his resistance to the tyranny of Julius Caesar which influenced the narratives and ideas surrounding the American Revolution.
resources.note: Students may choose this play OR Henry IV for Term 3.

resources.title: Celebrated Cases of Judge Dee
resources.author: Robert Van Gulik
resources.rationale: Despite the unfortunate cover image which you may want to edit, this book is a engaging novel featuring three interconnected detective mysteries written by an anonymous author in the eighteen century, over a hundred years before Sherlock Holmes! These stories were selected by the translator Robert Van Gulik because of their accessibility and interest to an English-speaking audience as well as their literary, historical, and moral depth. An expert on the Chinese legal code, Van Gulik portrays the customs of the time authentically but with sensitivity (witnesses were sometimes tortured to encourage confessions) and includes a helpful overview of the Chinese detective genre in his introduction. Morally, the story centers on Judge Dee who is faced with quandaries about how to uphold justice, treat everyone with respect and fairness, and live virtuously as a person both in authority and under authority - giving students a positive example to admire while also challenging their cultural norms.
resources.note: Grades 7-8 students may choose this book OR Treasure Island.

resources.title: Celtic Folklore Cooking
resources.author: Joanne Asala
resources.maySub: a cookbook from any culture that includes both recipes and a narrative illustrating how food connects to the culture
resources.note: Choose this OR Mexico in Your Kitchen, Classic Russian Cooking, Pomp and Sustenance, Gullah Geechee Home Cooking, or a cookbook from another culture of your choosing

resources.title: Cendrillon
resources.author: Robert D. San Souci
resources.rationale: French Cinderella Story

resources.title: Chains
resources.author: Laurie Halse Anderson
resources.rationale: This book depicts the beginnings of the American Revolution from the perspective of a slave girl in New York City. While other slaves are trying to decide whether to throw their lots in with the British or the Americans, Isabel is only interested in protecting her little sister. However, she soon finds herself caught up in a life of intrigue as she contemplates the meaning of freedom.

resources.title: Champlain
resources.author: Christopher Moore
resources.rationale: In this remarkable book, illustrated entirely with paintings, archival maps, and original artifacts, the author brings to life this complex man and, through him, creates a portrait of Canada in its earliest days.

resources.title: Charis in the World of Wonders: a Novel Set in Puritan New England
resources.author: Marly Youmans
resources.rationale: Beautiful novel set in the year's historical time period. Despite some difficult scenes, the book depicts the harsh realities of life with hope and beauty.

resources.title: Charity and Its Fruits
resources.author: Jonathan Edwards, Edited by Strobel
resources.rationale: Series of sermons by the 18th-century pastor, theologian, and missionary illustrating the most common form of American writing at the time.

resources.title: Charlotte's Web
resources.author: E.B. White
resources.rationale: The classic tale is about a spider, a pig, and much more. This book was chosen not only for its enduring literary quality but also to provide opportunities in their lessons for young readers to read books themselves.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Chasing Venus (Option 1)
resources.author: Andrea Wulf
resources.rationale: Follow the adventures of multiple scientists to all parts of the globe as they attempt to measure the transit of Venus and participate in the grand work of determining the size of the solar system!
resources.note: Choose this book OR The Race to Save the Lord God Bird

However, this will be a second resource and all topics will be taught in a way that students can see images online if they do not have the book on hand. This book was chosen due to its minuscule amount of nudity compared to other art books geared to teens.

resources.rationale: This book retells the legend of Clamshell Boy, who rescues a captured group of children from the dreaded wild woman Ishcus; includes information on the customs and lifestyle of the Makah Indians.

resources.title: Clan Apis

resources.rationale: Out of Print, but excellent graphic novel.

resources.title: Classic Russian Cooking

resources.title: Coding & Logic STEM Activity Book for Kids

resources.title: Coding for Kids: Python: Learn to Code with 50 Awesome Games and Activities

resources.title: Colonial Living
resources.author: Edwin Tunis
resources.rationale: Through detailed descriptions and line drawings, Edward Tunis provides students a glimpse into the past to see the houses, churches, schools, and everyday tools and equipment that were used by the American colonists in the 17th and 18th centuries. This book is also a great resource to inspire entries in your Book of Centuries.

resources.title: Colonization and the Wampanoag Story
resources.author: Linda Coombs
resources.rationale: It is important to see history from different perspectives. Not only does it give us a more accurate understanding of the past, but it also helps us to learn the stories of other people who are fellow image-bearers. This book tells about the life and culture of the Wampanoag before colonists arrived in America. It also tells how their lives changed as a result of the new colonists. This book sets the Natives' story in context by presenting the ideas and worldviews that led to the demise of the natives' way of life. Although these ideas and questions can be hard to face, we believe these discussions are part of a Mason education as students learn the value of different points of view and gain an understanding of the complexity of history.

resources.title: Color: A Course in Mastering the Art of Mixing Colors
resources.author: Betty Edwards
resources.rationale: This is an optional resource for students who would like a resource guide for color theory and/or would want to learn more than what will be covered in lessons.

resources.title: Coloreando Traditional Songs for Children in Spanish (Audio mp3 Download)
resources.author: Marta Gómez
resources.maySub: favorite streaming service or purchase individual songs for $1.00 each.
resources.rationale: This is a collection of traditional songs in Spanish.

resources.title: Come and Learn with Me
resources.author: Sheyenne Jumbo & Mindy Willett
resources.rationale: Nine-year-old Sheyenne Jumbo is a Dene girl who lives in Sambaa K'e (Trout Lake), Northwest Territories. In this book, she introduces young readers like herself to her community and traditions. The conversational tone of the book is complemented by the photographs of Sheyenne's family, her day-to-day life, and the beautiful landscape surrounding Trout Lake.

resources.title: Commodore Perry in the Land of the Shogun
resources.author: Rhoda Blumberg

resources.title: Communicating with Grace and Virtue: Learning to Listen, Speak, Text, and Interact as a Christian

resources.title: Conquistador Voices (Vol. 1)
resources.author: Kevin H. Siepel
resources.rationale: _Conquistador Voices_ provides an immersive journey through the Spanish Conquest of the Americas. Students will read accounts of what was said and done by those who were there. A fuller understanding of the context of history will be gained.
resources.note: This book contains sensitive content as eyewitness accounts are quoted extensively. Lesson Plans will alert students and teachers to specific readings to allow for prereading, guidance, and discussion.

resources.title: Conscience: What It Is, How to Train It, and Loving Those Who Differ

resources.title: Cool Jump Rope Tricks You Can Do

resources.title: Coolies
resources.author: Yin
resources.rationale: This is the story of two Chinese brothers who come to California to make a better life for themselves and their families back home. They find work helping to build the Transcontinental Railroad and find that life in America is much more difficult than they thought it would be.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Count Zinzendorf: Firstfruit

Bober presents a bi-focal view of the events leading to the Revolutionary War -- telling the story through the eyes of the heroes and rebels involved on _both_ sides of the Atlantic Ocean.

resources.title: Cross Among the Tomahawks

resources.rationale: A young Huron boy, Tsiko and his friend Satouta meet Father Jean de Brebeuf and begin a journey that will change his life. Set in the mid 1600s, this story paints a vivid picture of the Canadian Jesuit missionaries and their patient work with the peaceful Huron people.
resources.note: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read. This selection is more accessible for Grades 5-9. Content warning: There is some violence throughout and a graphic description of de Brebeuf's martyrdom at the end of the book.

resources.title: Cross Country: Geography for Children

As they encounter the different regions of the United States, the children learn about a variety of subjects, including basic geography concepts (landforms, waterbodies, and beginner map skills), as well as about such topics as local economies, climate, and regional plants and animals.
resources.note: Black-and-white version is available on Amazon for $16 ISBN: 978-1952118029.

The author, Mary Beacock Fryer, is a descendant of the Seaman family, who settled in Rockport, Ontario at the close of the eighteenth century.
