resources.author: Alexandra Stewart
resources.rationale: The fascinating account of the first men to reach the top of Mt. Everest in 1953.

resources.title: Every Valley: The Desperate Lives and Troubled Times That Made Handel's Messiah
resources.author: Charles King

resources.title: Everything Is A Poem
resources.author: J. Patrick Lewis (author), Maria Cristina Pritelli (illustrator)

resources.title: Everything Sad is Untrue (a true story)
resources.author: Daniel Nayeri
resources.rationale: An autobiographical novel told through the eyes of a 12-year-old Iranian refugee boy who fled the country because of his mother's Christianity. Chosen for the poignant way it introduces students to Persian history, literature, and storytelling and shows the relevance of learning history in order to love our neighbors today.

resources.title: Evidence Not Seen: A Woman's Miraculous Faith in the Jungles of World War II
resources.author: Darlene Deibler Rose
resources.rationale: The American missionary, Darlene Rose, recounts her story as a POW in a Japanese prison camp in the jungles of New Guinea during World War II.

resources.title: Excerpts from Great Women Authors, English Writers, Tellers of Tales, and other sources included in lesson plans.
Experiencing the Presence of God
resources.author: A.W. Tozer
resources.maySub: Be Confident: Live By Faith, Not by Sight by Wiersbe or a different commentary from your faith tradition.
resources.rationale: Tozer's insightful commentary on Hebrews.
resources.note:
Choose Tozer and/or Wiersbe.

This resource is written with a bit more scholarly tone than the Wiersbe "Be Series" option.

resources.title: Exploits of Xenophon
resources.author: Geoffrey Household
resources.rationale: This book retells much of the war hero's own story, a superb picture of a valiant Greek army and its impact upon the ancient civilization of the East.

resources.title: Exploration and Conquest
resources.author: Betsy & Giulio Maestro
resources.rationale: Christopher Columbus was not the first to discover the Americas, but his voyages led to European exploration of the New World. This book talks about the explorers and conquistadors who came to the Americas and how this affected the lives of those already living in this land.

resources.title: Eyes on the Prize, Season 1 (Prime Video)
resources.author: Crossley, et al (producers)
resources.rationale: 6-episode documentary on the civil rights era.
resources.note: PBS Documentary. Purchase Season 1 as lessons include all episodes.

resources.title: F is for French
resources.author: Elaine Arsenault
resources.rationale: This ABC book is set in Montreal. Students will learn about the French Canadian culture as they study French vocabulary.
resources.note: This will be used for picture study. The text for literature will be provided in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Family Pictures/Cuadros de familia
resources.author: Carmen Lomas Garza
resources.rationale: The vibrant paintings and warm personal stories depict memories of the author growing up in a traditional Mexican-American family. This book is a great way to learn Spanish vocabulary during the picture study lessons.

resources.title: Famous Canadian Stories
resources.author: George E. Tait
resources.rationale: It is an engaging narrative that tells about the events and people that have shaped Canada, beginning with the explorers searching for a Northwest passage.

resources.title: Famous Justices of the Supreme Court
resources.author: James J. Flynn

resources.title: Farewell to Manzanar
resources.author: Jeanne Wakatsuki Houston and James D. Houston

resources.title: Fascinating Bible Studies on Every Parable
resources.author: Dr. William H. Marty
resources.rationale: This book provides short studies on every parable in the Bible with a summary of the parable, the Scripture reference where it can be found, information on the historical and cultural setting, and key points. Readings will be assigned to go along with the students' readings in the four gospels.

resources.title: Fatal Fever: Tracking Down Typhoid Mary
resources.author: Gail Jarrow

resources.title: Fatty Legs
resources.author: Christy Jordan-Fenton and Margaret Olemaun Pokiak-Fenton
resources.rationale: Accompanied by personal photos and emotional illustrations, Margaret-Olemaun Pokiak-Fenton shares her experiences of attending residential school in Canada’s North in the 1940s. This book gives students an honest and age-appropriate introduction to a dark chapter of Canada’s history. Students will follow Olemaun, an 8 year-old who desperately wants to learn to read, as she travels to residential school and discovers everything is not as she hoped.

resources.title: Favorite Folk Tales from Around the World
resources.author: Jane Yolen

resources.title: Favorite Folktales from Around the World
resources.author: Jane Yolen

resources.title: Fever 1793
resources.author: Laurie Halse Anderson
resources.rationale: The Revolutionary War might be over, but there is a new threat in Philadelphia: Yellow Fever. This is a timely read, since students have experienced a pandemic themselves. Alert: Not appropriate for sensitive children.

resources.title: Fierce Convictions: The Extraordinary Life of Hannah More: Poet, Reformer, Abolitionist
resources.author: Karen Swallow Prior

resources.title: Fierce Wars & Faithful Loves
resources.author: Edmund Spenser, translated by Roy Maynard
resources.rationale: Edmund Spencer, a 16th-century poet whom Milton considered to be a better teacher than the medieval theologians, wrote an epic tale of adventure, love, noble deeds, and faith. Roy Maynard's annotation gives helpful notes and background to help students enjoy this epic story of St. George and the Dragon.

resources.title: Fifty Steps in Sight-Singing
resources.author: Arthur Somervell
resources.rationale: Classic text to teach sight-singing.

resources.title: Fighting for the Forest: How FDR's Civilian Conservation Corps Helped Save America
resources.author: P. O'Connell Pearson
resources.rationale: This book tells the story of the Civilian Conservation Corps, created during the Depression era to bring jobs to many men and preserve our national parks. Through the personal journeys of young men, students get a better understanding of that era of history and think about the government's role in the economy and job creation.

resources.title: Fine Print: A Story about Johann Gutenberg
resources.author: Joann Johansen Burch
resources.rationale: This is the story of the man who invented the printing press and gave the world the gift of books. This book tells the journey of a boy from a small town in Germany who loved books to a man who never gave up his dream to make the mass spread of literature a reality. His invention had a direct impact on the development of the Renaissance and Reformation.

resources.title: Fireboat: The Heroic Adventures of the John J. Harvey
resources.author: Maira Kalman
resources.rationale: This picture book tells about the events of 9/11 for younger readers. A retired fireboat is called back to duty to fight fires when the Twin Towers go up in flames.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

resources.title: First Nations Version: An Indigenous Translation of the New Testament
resources.author: Terry M. Wildman
resources.rationale: The FNV is a dynamic equivalence translation of the New Testament that captures the simplicity, clarity, and beauty of Native storytellers in English while remaining faithful to the original language of the Bible.  Helpful insights into the NT and Native cultures can be gained.

resources.title: First You Write a Sentence
resources.author: Joe Moran
resources.rationale: A writer's thoughts and advice on style and structure in writing.

resources.title: Five Months on the Missouri River: Paddling a Dugout Canoe
resources.author: Thomas Elpel
resources.rationale: You are on the river with Thomas and crew as they explore the Missouri from source to St. Louis in the reverse footsteps of Lewis and Clark noting what has changed and what remains the same.

resources.title: Five Presidents: My Extraordinary Journey with Eisenhower, Kennedy, Johnson, Nixon, and Ford
resources.author: Clint Hill and Lisa McCubbin

resources.title: Flight
resources.author: Connie Brummel Crook
resources.rationale: Connie Brummel Crook, a descendant of the Waltermyer family, tells the story of her Loyalist ancestors' dangerous journey to Canada to escape harm from American rebel soldiers intent on discovering British sympathizers. Hans Waltermyer, the family patriarch, secretly aided the British through intelligence, and the story is told from the perspective of his oldest son, George. Loyalists came from various backgrounds but played a significant role in shaping Canada before Confederation. Hans Waltermyer - who later took the name John Walden Meyers - went on to found the town of Belleville in the early nineteenth century.

resources.title: Follow Follow: A Book of Reverso Poems
resources.author: Marilyn Singer

resources.title: Follow That Map!: A First Book of Mapping Skills
resources.author: Scot Ritchie
resources.rationale: Follow That Map! is an interactive picture book that explains and demonstrates key mapping concepts. Kids will enjoy following Sally and her friends as they search for Max and Ollie, a mischievous dog and cat on the lam from the backyard. Sally and friends take an imaginative trip through the neighborhood, city and country, around the world and beyond.

resources.title: Follow the Water from Brook to Ocean
resources.author: Arthur Dorros

resources.title: Forest Craft: A Child's Guide to Whittling in the Woodland
resources.author: Richard Irvine
resources.rationale: This is a book that can be turned to time and time again, through the different seasons and over many years. The skills learned can be treasured and passed down through generations in time-honored traditions.

resources.title: Forge
resources.author: Laurie Halse Anderson
resources.rationale: The Patriot Army was shaped and strengthened by the desperate circumstances of the Valley Forge winter. This is where Curzon the boy becomes Curzon the young man. In addition to the hardships of soldiering, he lives with the fear of discovery, for he is an escaped slave passing for free

resources.title: Fort Mose: Colonial America's Black Fortress of Freedom
resources.author: Deagan & Macmahon
resources.rationale: An essential but often overlooked part of the story of the colonial era is told in this picture-rich account of an African American settlement in Spanish Florida.

resources.title: Founding Brothers: The Revolutionary Generation
resources.author: Joseph Ellis
resources.rationale: Six events bring to life the issues and individuals of the early days of the nation and students learn historical thinking skills by watching a master at work.

resources.title: Frances Barkley: Eighteenth-century Seafarer
resources.author: Cathy Converse
resources.rationale: This book is a creative non-fiction account of Frances Barkley's circumnavigation of the globe with her sea-captain husband, based on her written recollection of the journey. The Barkleys were among the first Europeans to encounter the Huu-ay-aht First Nation people, whose traditional lands on the west coast of Vancouver Island were later named Barkley Sound. _Frances Barkley_ also provides a fascinating window into what the close of the 18th century was like in places all over the world, and students will use their atlases to map her journey.

resources.title: Francis and Clare: Saints of Assisi
resources.author: Helen Walker Homan
resources.rationale: Helen Homan has captured all the excitement and beauty of the lives of these saints from their childhood growing up together in Assisi to their profound conversion and lifelong influence.
resources.note: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read over the year.

resources.title: Frankenstein: A Guide to Reading and Reflecting edited
resources.author: Karen Swallow Prior
resources.rationale: Classic work from the time period with helpful historical notes and questions for reflection.

resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: Contains audio recordings of lesson readings, interactive readings, and spoken grammar exercises.
resources.note: Available with lesson plans

resources.rationale: Contains markable copies of lesson readings, vocabulary lists, and more. Teacher edition includes answers to reading questions and grammar exercises.
resources.note: Hard copy available with French lessons in the Alveary print store.

resources.note: This notebook is also available as part of hard-copy lessons in the print store.

resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This notebook contains markable copies of lesson readings, vocabulary lists, and answers to reading questions and grammar exercises.

resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This notebook contains markable copies of lesson readings, vocabulary lists, and answers to reading questions and grammar exercises.
resources.note: This notebook is also available as part of hard-copy lessons in the print store.

resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: Contains markable copies of lesson readings, vocabulary lists, and answers to reading questions and grammar exercises.
resources.note: Available as a hard copy with French lessons in the print store.

resources.title: French: Student Notebook Grades 4-6
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This notebook contains markable copies of lesson readings, vocabulary lists, and answers to reading questions and grammar exercises.
resources.note: This notebook is available as a hard copy with French lessons in the print store.

resources.title: Friend of Science, Friend of Faith
resources.author: Greg Davidson
resources.rationale: A conversation starter on issues of science and faith.

resources.title: Friendship with God
resources.author: Mike McKinley
resources.rationale: This book aims to make John Owen’s masterful work _Communion with God_ accessible to a 21st Century audience. Students will be led on an exciting journey that fosters a deeper love for the Triune God of the Bible. The author accomplishes this task by exploring how each member of the Trinity relates to followers of Christ in distinct ways, while still maintaining a unity within the Godhead. The author’s writing style is very accessible and engaging.

resources.title: From The Mixed Up Files of Basil E. Frankweiler
resources.author: E.L. Konigsburg

resources.title: Frozen Land
resources.author: Jan Reynolds
resources.rationale: Kenalogak, a young girl, is part of the Inuit culture in Canada. How do people survive in such a cold climate? Watch as Kenalogak's family finds food and makes shelter and clothing for their survival.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

resources.title: Galileo: The Genius Who Charted the Universe
resources.author: Philip Steele
resources.rationale: This is an interesting biography that focuses on the life and discoveries of Galileo while also providing a rich context for understanding life in Europe in the 16th century. There are maps, timelines, and pictures of artifacts that are helpful for students' timelines and Book of Centuries.

resources.title: Galileo's Daughter
resources.author: Dava Sobel
resources.rationale: Inspired by a long fascination with Galileo, and by the remarkable surviving letters of his daughter Maria Celeste, a cloistered nun, Dava Sobel has crafted a biography that dramatically recolors the personality and accomplishments of this mythic figure.
resources.note: Choose ONE of the biographies listed for term 3.

resources.title: Gardner's Art Through the Ages
resources.author: Fred S. Kleiner, Christin J. Mamiya

resources.title: Gear Up!: Marvelous Machine Projects
resources.author: Keith Good
resources.rationale: Activity Book: creative machine-building projects

resources.title: General Biology
resources.author: Heather Ayala and Katherine Rogstad
resources.rationale: In a conversational tone and with reverence, the authors of this general biology text clearly guide students from the molecules of biology to the complexities of the human body and evolution.
resources.note: The publisher has announced that a new edition of this text will be coming later this year.  Lesson plans will be based on the first edition, so we recommend obtaining this text now.

resources.title: General Biology, 2nd Edition
resources.author: Heather Ayala & Katie Rogstad
resources.rationale: In a conversational tone and with reverence, the authors of this general biology text clearly guide students from the molecules of biology to the complexities of the human body and evolution.

resources.title: General Chemistry 3rd ed.
resources.author: John Mays
resources.rationale: An interesting and well-written introduction to the discipline of Chemistry.

resources.title: Geometry Curriculum Pack
resources.author: Harold Jacobs
resources.maySub: Geometry: A Guided Inquiry by Chakerian (mathwithoutborders.com/geometry/)
resources.rationale: A solid and interesting HS geometry course for all.
resources.note: May add an online class from [derekowens.com](http://derekowens.com/) if desired.

resources.title: GeoPuzzles
resources.rationale: Kids will learn geography in a fun and engaging way, while discussing the different countries and how they are related.

resources.title: George Washington
resources.author: Ingri and Edgar D-Aulaire
resources.rationale: Learn about the life and times of George Washington in this beautifully illustrated, classic children's book.

resources.title: George Washington, Spymaster
resources.author: Thomas B. Allen
resources.rationale: This award-winning book delves into George Washington’s role as a master of intelligence, revealing how he used spies, secret codes, invisible ink, and double agents to outmaneuver the British. This book begins with the  French and Indian War in 1753 and continues through the end of the Revolutionary War in 1783. The engaging book tells about real-life spy stories and how key figures such as Nathan Hale, Benjamin Tallmadge, and the Culper Ring played a crucial role in winning the war against Britain.

resources.title: George Washington's Mount Vernon: Official Guidebook
resources.author: Mount Vernon Ladies Association of the Union

resources.title: George Washington's World
resources.author: Genevieve Foster
resources.rationale: This book shows what was happening in other parts of the world during George Washington's lifetime. Contains many line drawings that will prove helpful for students beginning a Book of Centuries.
resources.note: The link provided is for Christianbook. The book is also available on Amazon, but the price is about double.

resources.title: George Whitefield: God's Anointed Servant in the Great Revival of the Eighteenth Century
resources.author: Arnold A. Dallimore
resources.rationale: God's accomplishments through George Whitefield are to this day virtually unparalleled as his reach through open-air preaching was widespread and led to revival in both the British Isles and America. Dallimore's biography gives an exciting view of Whitefield's work in the context of the 18th century.

resources.title: Get Started in Leather Crafting
resources.author: Tony & Kay Laier
resources.rationale: Several projects in this book will be referenced and taught; however, there are many more projects with readable instructions and great images in the book for students who want to spend more time on leather crafting. It is a great, inexpensive resource to have on hand.

resources.title: Getty-Dubay® Italic Handwriting Book B
resources.author: Handwriting Success
resources.maySub: penmanship model of your choice or Penny Gardner
resources.rationale: For the beginning reader, this book presents lowercase, capitals and numerals. With a short word and lively sentence on each page, this book engages the student.
resources.note: Choose this OR Italics by Penny Gardner. You do not need the Instruction Manual. Necessary instructions will be included in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Getty-Dubay® Italic Handwriting Book C
resources.author: Handwriting Success
resources.maySub: penmanship model of your choice or Penny Gardner
resources.rationale: The simple transition to cursive italic is introduced. Basic writing practice themes include: modes of transportation (automobile through zeppelin), days of the week, months of the year, and sentences. Capitals practice: cities of the USA. Includes numerals.
resources.note: Choose this OR Italics by Penny Gardner. You do not need the Instruction Manual. Necessary instructions will be included in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Getty-Dubay® Italic Handwriting Book D
resources.author: Handwriting Success
resources.maySub: penmanship model of your choice or Penny Gardner
resources.rationale: Writing practice for basic italic and cursive italic includes capitalization, vowel and consonant sounds, prefixes, suffixes, phonograms, homophones, tongue twisters, and six poem forms. Cursive capitals are introduced with historical development of each letter.
resources.note: Choose this OR Italics by Penny Gardner. You do not need the Instruction Manual. Necessary instructions will be included in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Getty-Dubay® Italic Handwriting Book E
resources.author: Handwriting Success
resources.maySub: penmanship model of your choice or Penny Gardner
resources.rationale: While practicing cursive italic, students explore the many facets of the world of science — the animal kingdom, DNA, photosynthesis, minerals, continents, biomes, our solar system, and galaxy. Practice with capitals: cities of the world and history of letters.
resources.note: Choose this OR Italics by Penny Gardner. You do not need the Instruction Manual. Necessary instructions will be included in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Getty-Dubay® Italic Handwriting Book F
resources.author: Handwriting Success
resources.maySub: penmanship model of your choice or Penny Gardner
resources.rationale: Figures of speech in the English language are used for cursive writing practice. Students will practice capital letters using the names of First Nation tribes and communities of North America. The exercises also explore the history of letters and numerals.
resources.note: Choose this OR Italics by Penny Gardner. You do not need the Instruction Manual. Necessary instructions will be included in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Getty-Dubay® Italic Handwriting Book G
resources.author: Handwriting Success
resources.maySub: penmanship model of your choice or Penny Gardner
resources.rationale: The final book in the Series contains basic and cursive writing practice to acquaint the student with the history of writing.  Part 3: edged pen writing.
resources.note: Choose this OR Italics by Penny Gardner. You do not need the Instruction Manual. Necessary instructions will be included in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Gilgamesh
resources.author: Bernarda Bryson
resources.rationale: Gilgamesh is the oldest known legend. In this beautiful, full-color version, the distinguished author and artist, Bernarda Bryson, has created a richly moving interpretation of the mighty deeds of Gilgamesh, the great hero-king, part god and part man.

resources.title: Give Me Liberty
resources.author: L.M. Elliott
resources.rationale: Life is tough for thirteen-year-old Nathaniel Dunn, an indentured servant in colonial Virginia. Then in a twist of luck, he meets Basil, a kind schoolmaster, and an arrangement is struck lending Nathaniel's labor to a Williamsburg carriage maker. Basil introduces Nathaniel to music, books, and philosophies that open his mind to new attitudes about equality. In 1775, as colonists voice their rage over England's taxation, Patrick Henry's words "Give me liberty, or give me death" become the sounding call for action. But what is the meaning of "liberty" in a country reliant on indentured servants and slaves?

resources.title: Gladiola Garden
resources.author: Effie Lee Newsome
resources.rationale: This book by a lesser-known American poet contains beautiful nature poetry and illustrations for children.

resources.title: Gladys Aylward: The Little Woman
resources.author: Gladys Aylward
resources.rationale: This engaging missionary biography will inspire students as they read about Gladys Aylward's (1902-1970) willingness to be used by God to serve people in China. Students will also gain an understanding of the cultural and historical context of China during the early 20th century.

resources.title: Globe
resources.maySub: any globe that shows both geographical features and place names
resources.rationale: We like that this globe is up to date and has raised landform features.

resources.title: God Bless the USA: Kids Sing Songs for America
resources.author: St. John's Children Choir
resources.rationale: Enjoy patriotic songs from the St. John's Children's Choir.

resources.title: God of All Things
resources.author: Andrew Wilson
resources.rationale: In _God of All Things_, pastor and author Andrew Wilson invites you to rediscover God through ordinary, everyday things. He explores the idea of a material world and presents a variety of created marvels that reveal the gospel in everyday life and fuel worship and joy in God.

resources.title: God's Bible Timeline: The Big Book of Biblical History
resources.author: Linda Finlayson
resources.rationale: Contains age-appropriate commentary on the eras of the Bible, along with detailed timelines, known dates, and a timeline poster. Lessons will refer to the timeline when reviewing stories and events.
resources.note: Use option one link to receive discount.

resources.title: God’s Big Picture: Tracing the Storyline of the Bible
resources.author: Vaughan Roberts
resources.rationale: Excellent overview of Bible history showing the outline of God's Kingdom plan from beginning to end.

resources.title: God's Smuggler (Young Reader's Edition)
resources.author: Brother Andrew
resources.rationale: This young reader's edition depicts Brother Andrew's adventures from a boy in Holland to an adult transporting Bibles during the Cold War into communist countries where it is illegal to be a Christian.

resources.title: Goldilocks and the Three Bears
resources.author: Teresa Mlawer
resources.rationale: This simplified retelling of a classic folk tale includes both English and Spanish text on each page.

resources.title: Grace Abounding to the Chief of Sinners
resources.author: John Bunyan

resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: Copywork and dictation passages taken from the books and poems from this year.
