resources.title: Grade 8 Copywork & Dictation Book
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: Copywork and dictation passages taken from the books and poems from this year.
resources.note: Also included in the Grade 8 Bundles available with Alveary Printing store.

resources.title: Grade 8 Student packet of copywork and dictation passages
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: Copywork and dictation passages taken from the books and poems from this year.
resources.note: Also included in the Grade 8 Bundles available with Alveary Printing store.

resources.title: Grammar Island
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.rationale: This program brings story, delight, and ideas to the study of grammar. _Grammar Island _introduces, in a simple fashion, the full four-level grammar analysis of (1) parts of speech, (2) parts of the sentence, (3) phrases, and (4) clauses.

resources.title: Grammar Island Teacher Manual (select pages)
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.note: Used with publisher's permission.

resources.title: Grammar Town
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.rationale: _Grammar Town_ builds on the foundation presented in _Grammar Island _and continues to bring delight and interest to the study of writing and grammar_._ It continues the full four-level grammar analysis of (1) parts of speech, (2) parts of the sentence, (3) phrases, and (4) clauses.

resources.title: Grammar Town Teacher's Manual (select pages)
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.note: Used with publisher permission.

resources.title: Grammar Voyage
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.rationale: Building on grammar concepts introduced in Grammar Island and Grammar Town, this book continues to help students explore the intricacies of grammar.

resources.title: Grammar Voyage Teacher's Manual (select pages)
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.note: Used with publisher permission.

resources.title: Grammarly for Students
resources.rationale: Helpful editing software to assist students with proofreading papers during revision lessons.

resources.title: Grandma Gatewood Hikes the Appalachian Trail
resources.author: Jennifer Thermes
resources.rationale: This longer picture book tells the true story of a 67-year-old grandma who was the first woman to solo hike the Appalachian Trail. It is a great supplement to our geography spine and contains great maps to follow her journey through the trail.
resources.note: Teachers may wish to check this book out from the library rather than purchase it, as it is only used for a couple of lessons.

resources.title: Great Expectations
resources.author: Charles Dickens
resources.maySub: A Christmas Carol, Cricket on the Hearth, or Hard Times
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Great Rivers of the World
resources.author: Volker Mehnert
resources.rationale: This is a beautifully illustrated atlas of important rivers around the world that incorporates culture, geography, and history. This will be used at various times throughout the year as different regions are studied. It may also be used in history.
resources.note: This will be used for several years as part of the geography lessons for 4th-8th grades.

resources.title: Great Stage of Fools: A Guide to Six Shakespeare Plays
resources.author: Peter Leithart
resources.rationale: Teacher resource that provides analysis and background information for the three plays scheduled this year.

resources.title: Green
resources.author: Laura Vaccaro Seeger
resources.rationale: Beautiful artwork showing that the color green has many variations and goes well with the color theory learned.

resources.title: Ground Zero: How a Photograph Sent a Message of Hope
resources.author: Don Nardo
resources.rationale: Photojournalism and "Ground Zero Spirit" that captured the story of 9/11.

resources.title: Growing a Revolution: Bringing Our Soil Back to Life
resources.author: David Montgomery
resources.rationale: Discussion of modern agriculture, the nature of soil, and how to sustainably steward the earth.
resources.note:
For the Botany Elective in HS, this title is optional and allows the teacher to increase the literature component when appropriate.

For the Microbiology Elective in HS, choose this book OR Microbe Hunters.
Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting and Audible.

resources.title: Gullah Geechee Home Cooking: Recipes from the Matriarch of Edisto Island
resources.author: Emily Meggett
resources.maySub: a cookbook from any culture that includes both recipes and a narrative illustrating how food connects to the culture
resources.note: Choose this OR Mexico in Your Kitchen, Classic Russian Cooking, Pomp and Sustenance, Celtic Folklore Cooking, or a cookbook from another culture of your choosing

resources.title: Gulliver's Travels
resources.author: Jonathan Swift
resources.rationale: Jonathan Swift's classic satire and forerunner of the modern novel which has remained popular since its release in 1726. Swift depicts memorable scenes to help his readers consider the human nature, society, and more.

resources.title: Guns for General Washington: A Story of the American Revolution
resources.author: Seymour Reit
resources.rationale: Filled with adventure, suspense, and historical detail, this book is based on the true story of Will Knox, a nineteen-year-old young man who transported 183 cannons from New York’s Fort Ticonderoga to Boston—in the dead of winter—to help George Washington win an important battle. This story of courage and bravery brings to life one of the most crucial yet overlooked events of the American Revolution.

resources.title: Habits of Grace
resources.author: David Mathis
resources.rationale: Personal Study: Basic encouragement in the spiritual disciplines of prayer, reading the Bible, and fellowship.

resources.title: Habits of Grace Study Guide
resources.author: David Mathis
resources.rationale: Personal Study: Useful for establishing the habits of prayer, Bible reading, and fellowship.

resources.title: Hamlet
resources.author: William Shakespeare
resources.rationale: _Hamlet_ is Shakespeare's most popular, and most puzzling, play.
resources.note: OPTIONAL for Grades 9-12 who may also choose to read a medieval mystery play (link included in lesson plans).

resources.title: Hamlet (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording
resources.rationale: This audio recording of Hamlet is superb and can help students pick up the flow of Shakespeare's prose.

resources.title: Handbook of Nature Study
resources.author: Anna Comstock
resources.maySub: the full-color seven-volume set from Living Books Press
resources.rationale: A must-have for nature study and outdoor object lessons, this book is incorporated into teacher preparation for science lessons. Older children may read for themselves as they find things they are interested in on their walks.

resources.title: Handel, Who Knew What He Liked
resources.author: M. T. Anderson (author), Kevin Hawkes (illustrator)

resources.title: Handle with Care: An Unusual Butterfly Journey
resources.author: Loree Griffin Burns

resources.title: Hands on Construction Puzzles
resources.author: NEPA--Odyssey of the Mind
resources.rationale:
"NEPA Odyssey of the Mind is pleased to present Spontaneous Problems Galore – an online collection of over 500 spontaneous problems started over 20 years ago!...In competition, every team solves a spontaneous problem. This part of the competition is called “Spontaneous” because teams don’t know what they’ll have to do until they enter the competition room. Solving spontaneous problems teaches students to “think on their feet.”
Challenge your students to complete these challenging, but fun, tasks!

resources.title: Hands-On Equations Deluxe Home Set
resources.author: Hands-On Equations
resources.rationale: Hands-On Equations is a very concrete introduction to abstract algebraic concepts.
resources.note:
Choose this or Denison.
The "Free" link will take you to a YouTube playlist where a master teacher goes through the first 22 lessons. 
➜ Manipulatives included.
➜ Must scroll down on site to purchase correct item.

resources.title: Hang a Thousand Trees with Ribbons: The Story of Phillis Wheatley
resources.author: Ann Rinaldi

resources.title: Hans Brinker or The Silver Skates
resources.author: Mary Mapes Dodge
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Hans Holbein: His Life and Works in 500 Images: An Illustrated Exploration of the Artist and his Context, with a Gallery of his Paintings and Drawings
resources.author: Rosalind Ormiston
resources.rationale: A beautiful, in-depth look into the life and work of Hans Holbein. The quality of information and reproductions in this text are beautiful. It's a great "coffee table" book. If you are enthralled with the royal family or King Henry VIII and all of his drama, this is a book that goes into detail as Holbein was King Henry VIII's Court painter.

resources.title: Hard Times
resources.author: Charles Dickens
resources.maySub: A Christmas Carol, Cricket on the Hearth, or Great Expectations
resources.rationale: A classic work from time period author.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Harlem Stomp!: A Cultural History of the Harlem Renaissance
resources.author: Laban Carrick Hill
resources.rationale: This book provides the background for Jacob Lawrence and his art.
resources.note: ONLY Grades 9-12.

resources.title: Hawaiki Rising
resources.author: Dr. Sam Low
resources.rationale: This is the saga of an astonishing revival of indigenous culture by voyagers who took hold of the old story and sailed deep into their ancestral past. Historical geography brings the time period to life.
resources.note: Read this OR Brendan Voyage.

resources.title: Heart and Soul: The Story of America and African Americans
resources.author: Kadir Nelson
resources.rationale: This book is written in the voice of an old African American grandmother taking a child on her knee to tell the stories of the black experience throughout American history.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Heart of a Samurai
resources.author: Margi Preus
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Henry and Mudge Books
resources.author: Cynthia Rylant
resources.rationale: Henry, feeling lonely on a street without any other children, finds companionship and love in a big dog named Mudge.

resources.title: Henry IV Part 1
resources.author: William Shakespeare
resources.rationale: Henry IV, one of Shakespeare's history plays, is set in 15th-century England and follows the reign of King Henry IV, who struggles to maintain control of his kingdom after usurping the throne from Richard II.
resources.note: Grades 9-12 may choose this play OR Cato by Joseph Addison for Term 3.

resources.title: Henry IV Part 1 (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording

resources.title: Henry IV Part 2 (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording

resources.title: Henry V (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording

resources.title: Her Seven Brothers
resources.author: Paul Goble
resources.rationale: When an Indian girl begins to make clothes beautifully decorated with porcupine quills for seven brothers she has not yet met, her parents believe that unseen powers have spoken to her.

resources.title: Here I Stand
resources.author: Roland H. Bainton
resources.rationale: Roland Bainton’s Here I Stand: A Life of Martin Luther remains the definitive introduction to the great Reformer and is essential reading for anyone seeking to understand this towering historical figure. This is a more challenging read for those wanting an in-depth look at Luther's life.
resources.note: Choose ONE of the biographies listed for term 3.

resources.title: Herein Is Love Vol. 1: Genesis
resources.author: Nancy Ganz
resources.rationale: An accessible commentary on Genesis written to students. Teachers or older students will read this book during lesson time. The author's goal is to help students see the character of God and the bigger picture of God's redemptive story.

resources.title: Herein Is Love, Vol. 2: Exodus
resources.author: Nancy Ganz
resources.rationale: This is an accessible commentary on Exodus written to students. Teachers or older students will read selections during lesson time. The author's goal is to help students see the character of God and the bigger picture of God's redemptive story.

resources.title: Herein Is Love: Numbers
resources.author: Nancy Ganz
resources.rationale: This is an accessible commentary on Numbers written to students. Teachers or older students will read selections during lesson time. The author's goal is to help students see the character of God and the bigger picture of God's redemptive story.

resources.title: Hiawatha
resources.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow; illus. Susan Jeffers
resources.rationale: This episode of the classic poem tells about the child Hiawatha and his mother.

resources.title: Hiawatha and the Peacemaker
resources.author: Robbie Robertson
resources.rationale: This is the traditional story of how Hiawatha brought rival tribes together to defeat the evil Tadodaho and form the powerful Iroquois Nation in the 14th century.
resources.note: Some images may be scary for sensitive children. Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Hiawatha and/or Courtship of Miles Standish
resources.author: Longfellow
resources.maySub: any collection with Hiawatha and/or the Courtship of Miles Standish.
resources.rationale: Collection of Longfellow's poetry along with historical information.

resources.title: Hidden Figures Young Readers' Edition
resources.author: Margot Lee Shetterly
resources.rationale: This true story tells about four African American female mathematicians at NASA who were part of the space program. This story incorporates many important topics that are part of US History during this period. These topics include racial segregation, World War II, civil rights, Cold War, and the space race.

resources.title: High School Handbook
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This manual covers everything from transcripts to testing and from college to trade careers (plus a whole lot more). Like an Alveary lesson plan, this book is simply a tool that is only effective when backed by Charlotte Mason’s philosophy of education.

resources.title: Historic Poems and Ballads
resources.author: Rupert S. Holland
resources.rationale: Used for multiple history rotations

resources.title: Historical Atlas of the World 6th Ed.
resources.author: Rand McNally
resources.rationale: Presents important periods and turning points in 5,000 years of history. Thematic maps include literacy, languages, religions, and more. Used across curriculum.

resources.title: Historical Dance Instructional Video Collection
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: These are dances that were popular during the historical time period being studied.
resources.note: Videos available in lesson plans.

resources.title: History of the World in 1000 Objects
resources.author: Smithsonian
resources.rationale: Helpful reference to use as a resource for Book of Centuries.

resources.title: History of Tom Jones: A Foundling
resources.author: Henry Fielding

resources.title: Hoffman Academy
resources.author: Joseph Hoffman
resources.note: Free piano lessons are available online; premium membership is available ($20.00/mo.).

resources.title: Holbein
resources.author: Norbert Wolf
resources.rationale: This book brings together key Holbein paintings to explore his illustrious and international career as well as the courtly drama and radical religious change that informed his work.
resources.note: OPTIONAL Teacher Resource For Grades 1-6.  Assigned readings are included in the lessons for Grades 7-12.

resources.title: Holbein the Younger: 52 Paintings (Masterpieces)
resources.author: Maria Tsaneva
resources.rationale: A very short bio with some spelling errors but many reproductions of good quality. Great for all grade levels.

resources.title: Home Economics: Fourteen Essays
resources.author: Wendell Berry
resources.rationale: A collection of essays on important citizenship topics.

resources.title: Home Study Companion: Algebra 2/Trigonometry
resources.author: Math Without Borders
resources.rationale: Video lessons which accompany Foerster's Algebra 2/Trig

resources.title: Home Study Companion: Calculus
resources.author: Math Without Borders
resources.maySub: an online course with derekowens.com
resources.rationale: Video lessons to accompany Foerster's Calculus
resources.note: Begin Calculus when students finish Precalculus. Follow instructions to purchase textbook and materials in link.

resources.title: Home Study Companion: Physics
resources.author: Math Without Borders
resources.rationale: This living lecture series teaches the basic concepts of physics by guiding students to mathematically analyze moving objects in the world around them.

resources.title: Home Study Companion: Precalculus
resources.author: Math Without Borders
resources.maySub: an online course with derekowens.com
resources.rationale: Video lessons to accompany Foerster's Precalculus
resources.note: Begin Precalculus when students finish Algebra 2/Trig.  Follow instructions to purchase textbook and materials in link.

resources.title: Homebuilding and Woodworking in Colonial America
resources.author: C. Keith Wilbur
resources.rationale: This book offers an in-depth look at how colonial buildings were made and includes wonderful line drawings suitable for copying into a Book of Centuries.

resources.title: Honey Bee (Young Zoologist): A First Field Guide to the World's Favorite Pollinating Insect
resources.author: Priyadarshini Chakrabarti Basu
resources.rationale: Also available on Kindle and Audible.

resources.title: Honeybee: Poems and Short Prose
resources.author: Naomi Shihab Nye
resources.rationale: Also available on Kindle and Audible.

resources.title: How Canadians Govern Themselves (PDF)
resources.rationale: Explore Canada’s parliamentary system, from the decisions made by the Fathers of Confederation to the daily work of parliamentarians in the Senate and House of Commons. Useful information on Canada’s Constitution, the judicial system, and provincial and municipal powers is gathered together in this one reference book.

resources.title: How Do Birds Find Their Way?
resources.author: Roma Gans

resources.title: How Does Sanctification Work?
resources.author: David Powlison
resources.rationale: Weaving together personal stories, biblical exposition, and theological reflection, David Powlison highlights the personal and particular means God uses to make us more like Jesus.

resources.title: How the Stars Fell Into the Sky: A Navajo Legend
resources.author: Jerrie Oughton
resources.rationale: This retelling of a Navajo folktale explains how First Woman tried to write the laws of the land using stars in the sky, only to be thwarted by the trickster Coyote.

resources.title: How the States Got Their Shapes
resources.author: Mark Stein

resources.title: How They Built the Statue of Liberty
resources.author: Mary Shapiro
resources.note: Out of print. Alveary PDF used with permission.

resources.title: How to Think: A Survival Guide for a World at Odds
resources.author: Alan Jacobs
resources.rationale: What does it mean to think? How do we develop convictions and yet recognize the way our communities form us? In this book, Jacobs takes a philosophical look at thinking and logic. Helpful to prepare students for life after high school.

resources.title: HS Chem Intro
resources.author: Danielle Merritt-Sunseri
resources.note: Watch this introduction to glimpse our video companion lessons that accompany High School Chemistry.

resources.title: Hudson
resources.author: Janice Weaver
resources.rationale: This book is a great way for students to learn about the brave explorer with a river and bay named after him. He should be remembered not for his tragic end, but for how he advanced our understanding of the world.

resources.title: Hudson Taylor: Deep in the Heart of China
resources.author: Janet & Geoff Benge

resources.title: Hudson's Bay Company Adventures
resources.author: Elle Andra-Warner
resources.rationale: This book traces the history of the Hudson's Bay Company from its earliest days as a fur-trading enterprise started by the resourceful and canny pair of Radisson and des Groseilliers, to its establishment as a Canadian institution. Along the way we will meet a cast of memorable, yet largely unknown, characters, and learn how the story of the Hudson's Bay Company is inextricable from the history of pre-Confederation Canada: in particular, how it was shaped by events of conflict, compromise, and co-operation between various French, English, and Indigenous groups.
resources.note: Paperbacks recently went out of stock and we are in contact with the publisher to find out when to expect them back. In the meantime, there is a Kindle edition and a fair number of used copies available.

resources.title: Huguenot Garden
resources.author: Douglas Jones
resources.rationale: Follow the lives of twin sisters Rene and Albret in a French Protestant family as they work, worship, and suffer persecution in the late seventeenth century.

resources.title: Hunahpu & Xbalanque: Hero Twins of Popol Vuh​
resources.author: Karel Baresh
resources.rationale: A unique retelling of a classic Mayan legend to broaden students' mythology readings, the adventures of the Hero Twins is rescued from a tattered 150-year-old expedition journal and translated into English.

resources.title: Hurlbut's Story of the Bible
resources.author: Jesse Lyman Hurlbut
resources.rationale: Contains stories from both the Old and New Testaments in a very engaging narrative; omits sections that are unsuitable for younger children. The author adheres to the Bible without embellishment, opinion, or doctrine, making this volume appropriate for any denomination.
resources.note: The free online option has different page numbers than the lesson plans, but the chapter numbers are the same.

resources.title: Hymns, Spirituals, & Folk Songs PDF
resources.author: Alveary
resources.note: ONLY Grades 9-12 should print. Selections included in Our Work packets for Grades 1-8 (listed in Resources). Audio lessons and other resources available in lesson plans.

resources.title: Hymns, Spirituals, & Folk Songs PDF
resources.author: Alveary
resources.note: Selections are also included in Our Work packets for Grades 1-12. Audio lessons and other resources are available in lesson plans.

resources.title: I Am a Man: Chief Standing Bear's Journey for Justice
resources.author: Joe Starita
resources.rationale: The story of Ponca removal from Nebraska in the later part of the nineteenth century and Chief Standing Bear's fight for freedom in the U.S. Courts.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: I am Joe's Body
resources.author: J.D. Ratcliffe
resources.rationale: A creative first person narrative from the "inside" of Joe's body.

resources.title: I Contain Multitudes
resources.author: Ed Yong
resources.rationale: Cutting-edge research on microbes.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting and Audible.

resources.title: I Was a Teenager in the American Revolution
resources.author: Elizabeth Metz

resources.title: I, Juan De Pareja
resources.author: Elizabeth de Trevino
resources.rationale: Historical fiction based on the true story of Juan de Pareja who was enslaved to the famous Spanish painter Diego Velázquez and became a painter in his own right.

resources.title: I, Julian
resources.author: Claire Gilbert
resources.rationale: Compelled by the powerful visions she had when close to death, Julian finds a way to live a life of freedom - as an anchoress, bricked up in a small room on the side of a church - and to write of what she has seen. The result, passed from hand to hand, is the first book to be written by a woman in English.
resources.note: This book contains sensitive content. Lesson Plans will alert students and teachers to specific readings to allow for prereading, guidance, and discussion.  Students will gain insights into what it might have looked like to live for God in a different time and place.

resources.title: I, Too, Sing America: Three Centuries of African American Poetry
resources.author: Catherine Clinton
resources.rationale: This is a collection of poems from 25 African American poets across three centuries. Meaningful illustrations and brief biographies bring context to the poems.

resources.title: I, Vivaldi
resources.author: Janice Shefelman (author), Tom Shefelman (illustrator)
resources.rationale: A picture book inspired by the life of Antonio Vivaldi.

resources.title: If You Can Keep It
resources.author: Eric Metaxas
resources.rationale: Important ideas covering government and civic responsibility.

resources.title: Illustrated Guide to Home Biology Experiments
resources.author: Robert & Barbara Thompson
resources.rationale: Used only for Microbiology experiments

resources.title: In Suspect Terrain
resources.author: John McPhee
resources.rationale: McPhee is a master of geological literature, and this book is the second part of his larger work Annals of the World.

resources.title: In the Beginning: Creation Stories from Around the World
resources.author: Virginia Hamilton
resources.rationale: This book helps us to understand the perspectives and worldviews of ancient peoples.

resources.title: In the Beginning: The Story of the King James Bible
resources.author: Alister McGrath
resources.rationale: This fascinating history of a literary and religious masterpiece explores the forces that obstructed and ultimately led to the decision to create an authorized translation, the method of translation and printing, and the central role the King James version of the Bible played in the development of modern English.

resources.title: In the Days of Giants
resources.author: Abbie Farwell Brown
resources.rationale: The Greeks were not the only ones with a story tradition that influenced Western culture. These Norse stories have also been highly influential, and Brown has retold them beautifully.

resources.title: In the Footsteps of Alexander
resources.author: Miles Doleac
resources.rationale: A well-researched, picture-rich biography of Alexander the Great.

resources.title: In the Shadow of the Alamo
resources.author: Sherry Garland

resources.title: Inferno (The Divine Comedy)
resources.author: Dante Alighieri, translated by Anthony Esolen
resources.rationale: A bilingual edition of Dante's masterpiece that allows students to get a taste of this Italian epic from our time period.

resources.title: Introductory Chemistry: A Foundation
resources.author: Steven S. Zumdahl & Donald J. DeCoste
resources.rationale: Masters at inspiring and engaging students, the authors of this best-selling text combine problem-solving strategies, early coverage of chemical reactions, accessible explanations and visualizations, and an emphasis on everyday applications to facilitate understanding.
resources.note: Available in print or eBook with enhanced typesetting and audio. Previous edition is acceptable.

resources.title: Introductory Physics 3rd Edition
resources.author: John Mays
resources.rationale: An introduction to the discipline of physics appropriate for 9th graders.
resources.note: Answer keys, grading help, pre-lab discussion guides, lab instruction, and other teacher helps included with the lesson plans.

resources.title: Invincible Microbe
resources.author: Jim Murphy
resources.rationale: Murphy tells the story of an ancient and elusive microbe, weaving together ideas from science, history, and ethics. This author is a master storyteller, and we can't imagine a better way to continue our journey through natural history and into the very timely topic of microbiology and infectious disease.

resources.title: Ion (Board Game)
resources.author: Genius Games
resources.rationale: This fast-paced card game is perfect for science lovers of all ages. In _Ion_, players build compounds by matching ions with the correct charges—learning the basics of ionic bonding as they play. It’s a great way to mix chemistry with competition, making science both accessible and exciting. _Ion_ is a blast!

resources.title: Irena's Children: A True Story of Courage
resources.author: Tilar J. Mazzeo

resources.title: Isaac Newton
resources.author: Mitch Stokes
resources.rationale: Biography related to the history rotation

resources.title: Italics: Beautiful Handwriting for Children
resources.author: Penny Gardner
resources.maySub: penmanship model of your choice or Getty-Dubay Handwriting Series
resources.rationale: We like this model because it is lovely, yet simple. Both the print and cursive models are in italic, making this a solid foundation for fine lettering later. Some may prefer a more traditional cursive model.
resources.note: Choose this OR Getty-Dubay Handwriting Series.

resources.title: Itse Selu: Cherokee Harvest Festival
resources.author: Daniel Pennington
resources.rationale: A captivating glimpse of Cherokee life in pre-Columbian North America. Join Little Wolf's family as they prepare to celebrate Itse Selu, the harvest festival. As night approaches the village, the magic of anticipation fills the air. The luscious feast, Grandfather's storytelling, and the sacred corn dance weave a magical tapestry of tradition.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

resources.title: James Herriot's Treasury of Animal Stories
resources.author: James Herriot

resources.title: Jane Eyre: A Guide to Reading and Reflecting
resources.author: Karen Swallow Prior
resources.rationale: Book text is included in the resource.

resources.title: Jesus Through Middle Eastern Eyes
resources.author: Kenneth E. Bailey
resources.rationale: Beginning with Jesus' birth, Ken Bailey leads you on a kaleidoscopic study of Jesus throughout the four Gospels. Bailey examines the life and ministry of Jesus with attention to the Lord's Prayer, the Beatitudes, Jesus' relationship to women, and especially Jesus' parables.

resources.title: Johnny Tremain
resources.author: Esther Forbes
resources.rationale: Fourteen-year-old Johnny Tremain, an apprentice silversmith with a bright future ahead of him, injures his hand in a tragic accident, forcing him to look for other work. In his new job as a horse-boy, riding for the patriotic newspaper The Boston Observer, and as a messenger for the Sons of Liberty, he encounters John Hancock, Samuel Adams, and Dr. Joseph Warren.  Soon, Johnny is involved in the pivotal events of the American Revolution, from the Boston Tea Party to the first shots fired at Lexington.

resources.title: Journal of Henry David Thoreau
resources.author: Henry David Thoreau
resources.rationale: A classic work from time period author.

resources.title: Journey Back to Freedom
resources.author: Catherine Johnson
resources.rationale: The story of Olaudah Equiano.

resources.title: Journey into God's Word
resources.author: J. Scott Duvall and J. Daniel Hays
resources.rationale: This book introduces readers to an interpretive framework that makes in-depth Bible study more accessible. There is also a section that explains why there are different Bible translations as well as how to select interpretive resources such as commentaries, atlases, and Bible dictionaries to aid in Bible study.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Joyful Noise: Poems for Two Voices
resources.author: Paul Fleischman
resources.rationale: This Newbery Award-winning book is a collection of enjoyable poems that celebrates the insect world and is to be read by two readers at the same time.

resources.title: Jump Back, Paul: The Life and Poems of Paul Laurence Dunbar
resources.author: Sally Derby

resources.title: Jump Rope Masters Tutorials
resources.rationale: Isolated skill tutorials for variations.

resources.title: Ka-ha-si and the Loon: An Eskimo Legend
resources.author: Terri Cohlene
resources.rationale: In this beloved Eskimo legend, an idle sleepyhead becomes the champion who saves his people from famine and disaster.

resources.title: Kateri Tekakwitha: Mohawk Maiden
resources.author: Evelyn Brown
resources.rationale: Tells the story of Kateri Tekakwitha, a Mohawk girl who is kidnapped by the Iroquois. Kateri converts to the Catholic faith through the work of Jesuit missionaries and devotes her life to following Christ.
resources.note: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read. This selection is more appropriate for Grades 5-9. Content warning: Some descriptions of violence.

resources.title: Kazoos
resources.author: BTOP Store
resources.rationale: Kazoo along with the term's hymn, spirituals, or folk songs as a fun way to practice learning the melody. Can use any kind of kazoo.

resources.title: Keats: Poems (Everyman's Library)
resources.author: John Keats
resources.rationale: Keats is now considered a Romantic poet, but in his own day he was not. As Beethoven stands as a bridge between Classical and Romantic music, Keats stands in between Romantic and Modern poetry.

resources.title: Keep a current events calendar
resources.note: Suggested news sources will be listed in the lesson plans.

resources.title: Kids at Work: Lewis Hine and the Crusade Against Child Labor
resources.author: Russell Freedman

resources.title: King Arthur: Tales from the Round Table
resources.author: Andrew Lang

resources.title: King of the Wind: The Story of the Godolphin Arabian
resources.author: Marguerite Henry
resources.rationale: This beautiful story is partly historical fiction set during the early 1700s in Morocco, France, and England, telling the story of the thoroughbred lineage. But it is mostly a poignant tale of remarkable friendship between a boy and his horse.

resources.title: Knowing God's Truth
resources.author: Jon Nielson
resources.rationale: In his book _Knowing God’s Truth_, pastor Jon Nielson gives a clear, meaningful, and practical introduction to systematic theology. This set includes a copy of the book and the companion workbook, covering the basic categories of systematic theology―including Scripture, humanity, sin, the church, and more.

resources.title: Knowing the Bible: Genesis
resources.author: Mitchell M. Kim
resources.rationale: This guide helps us see how the storyline of Genesis foreshadows and connects to the good news about Jesus, and offers penetrating exegetical insights for those of us seeking to better understand God’s plan to bring blessing to all nations.

resources.title: Knowing the Bible: John
resources.author: Justin Buzzard
resources.rationale: With contributions from an array of influential pastors and church leaders, these gospel-centered studies will help Christians see and cherish the message of God’s grace on every page of the Bible.

resources.title: Kristin Lavansdratter
resources.author: Sigrid Undset
resources.rationale: _Kristin Lavransdatter _interweaves political, social, and religious history with the daily aspects of family life to create a colorful, richly detailed tapestry of Norway during the fourteenth-century.

resources.title: Ladybug Kit with voucher for larvae
resources.author: Home Science Tools

resources.title: Lafayette and the American Revolution
resources.author: Russell Freeman
resources.rationale: When the Marquis de Lafayette ran off to join the American Revolution against the explicit orders of the king of France, he was a strong-willed nineteen-year-old who had never set foot on a battlefield. Although the U.S. Congress granted him an honorary commission only out of respect for his title and wealth, Lafayette quickly earned the respect of his fellow officers with his bravery, devotion to the cause of liberty, and incredible drive.

resources.title: Lars Romam Odit: A Latin Novella
resources.author: Andrew Olimpi
resources.rationale: Written with the novice-level reader of Latin in mind—low unique word count, a full glossary, and many illustrations--_Lars Romam Odit_ is an ideal first encounter in an exciting period of Roman history.
resources.note: Only needed if using Alveary Online course.

resources.title: Leah's Pony
resources.author: Elizabeth Friedrich
resources.rationale: This story about a family during the Dust Bowl of the 1930s captures the hardships of life and the selfless act of one girl who strives to save the family farm.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

resources.title: Leaves of Grass
resources.author: Walt Whitman
resources.rationale: Collection of poetry from the time period along with historical information.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Les plus belles fables de La Fontaine
resources.author: Jean de La Fontaine

resources.title: Lettering and Modern Calligraphy: A Beginner's Guide: Learn Hand Lettering and Brush Lettering
resources.author: Paper Peony Press
resources.rationale: This is a great book to help with transferring skills from the chalkboard to paper. Students will want to start using this after completing Term 1.

resources.title: Lettering with Purpose: Creative Techniques and Prompts for Making Meaningful, Inspirational Hand-lettered Art
resources.author: Brittany Luiz
resources.rationale: This is a great book to help with transferring skills from the chalkboard to paper. Students will want to start using this after completing Term 1.

resources.title: Letters of the Late Ignatius Sancho
resources.author: Ignatius Sancho

resources.title: Liberty!: How the Revolutionary War Began
resources.author: Lucille Recht Penner
resources.rationale: This book is a great introduction for younger students about the events leading up to the Revolutionary War. With great illustrations and engaging text, students will learn about the causes of the war and the reactions of the colonists to the heavy taxes imposed by England.  Students will read about key moments such as the Boston Tea Party, the Battle of Bunker Hill, and the writing of the Declaration of Independence.

resources.title: Life on Surtsey: Iceland's Upstart Island
resources.author: Loree Griffin Burns
resources.rationale: In 1963, a volcano erupted and created a new island off the coast of Iceland. This book tells the story of the scientists who are watching and recording life unfold through primary succession.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting.

resources.title: Like a Bird: The Art of the American Slave Song
resources.author: Cynthia Grady
resources.rationale: This is a collection of African American spirituals, along with their stories and beautiful illustrations.
resources.note: 1-2 songs from this book are chosen most years.

resources.title: Lincoln: A Photobiography
resources.author: Russell Freedman
resources.rationale: This book follows the events leading up to, during, and after the Civil War through the life of Abraham Lincoln. This is the first war during which photography was used to show the people back home what war was really like, so the images capture not only the events, but also the new technology of the age.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Lion in the Gateway
resources.author: Mary Renault
resources.maySub: Story of Civilization (ch.13-22) by Philip Campbell if you already own it. However, lesson plans will not be provided for that book.
resources.rationale: Mary Renault, a master storyteller known for her novels about ancient Greece, weaves historical facts with vivid storytelling in this book that brings the people of ancient Greece to life. This book begins with the historical roots of the people of Ancient Greece and tells how they came to love their freedom more than anything else. The remainder of the book retells iconic events like The Battle of Marathon, the stand of the Spartans at Thermopylae, and the naval triumph at Salamis. Students will learn about historical figures such as Themistocles, Leonidas, and Xerxes, as well as the ordinary Greek citizens who valued courage and resilience.

resources.title: Little Heathens: Hard Times and High Spirits on an Iowa Farm During the Great Depression
resources.author: Mildred Armstrong Kalish

resources.title: Little Rock Girl 1957: How a Photograph Changed the Fight for Integration
resources.author: Shelley Tougas

resources.title: Little Women
resources.author: Louisa May Alcott
resources.maySub: Call of the Wild by London or another Alcott novel.
resources.rationale: A classic work from time period author.
resources.note: Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Little Women (Part 1)
resources.author: Louisa May Alcott
resources.rationale: Although this book is set during the Civil War and the family patriarch is off serving with the Union army, the story does not center on it. Instead, it follows four sisters as they grow and learn to live full and happy lives.
resources.note:
Grades 7-8: Choose this OR Captains Courageous.
Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Longitude
resources.author: Dava Sobel
resources.rationale: A read that will sweep students into the time period where they will discover the excitement of new scientific inventions that we take for granted today.

resources.title: Looking at Pictures: An Introduction to Art for Young People
Los Musicos del Pueblo de Bremen / The Bremen Town Musicians
resources.author: Brian Wildsmith

resources.title: Lunch Counter Sit-Ins: How Photographs Helped Foster Peaceful Civil Rights Protests
resources.author: Danielle Smith-Llera
resources.rationale: Photographic depiction of the civil rights movement and the organized peaceful demonstrations protesting segregation.

resources.title: Macbeth
resources.author: William Shakespeare
resources.rationale: This is one of Shakespeare's most famous tragedies, set in medieval Scotland. The play follows Macbeth, a brave Scottish general who receives a prophecy from three witches that he will become King of Scotland.

resources.title: Macbeth (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording

resources.title: Madeleine Takes Command
resources.author: Ethel Brill
resources.rationale: This historical novel, set in 17th century New France, features Madeleine de Vercheres a teenage girl who takes up arms in defense of family, country, and faith against the Iroquois.

resources.title: Magic Schoolbus Series
resources.author: Joanna Cole
resources.rationale: Join Ms. Frizzle and her class as they go on adventures to learn about science.

resources.title: Magic Tree House Books
resources.author: Mary Pope Osborne
resources.rationale: Children travel back in time to learn about history.

resources.title: Making of Canada: An Epic History in Twenty Extraordinary Lives
resources.author: Greg Koabel
resources.rationale: In this engaging book, Greg Koabel challenges the notion that pre-Confederation Canada unfolded in a linear fashion, and instead suggests that nation-building involved greater "regional, national, and human diversity" than is typically acknowledged.  To illustrate this argument, Koabel introduces his readers to twenty episodes significant to Canada's history, but whose major players have been largely forgotten. These biographical vignettes give readers a more personal - and memorable - connection to Canadian history.
resources.note:
This book will be published May 2025.
This book will be used over two years in high school.

resources.title: Making Your Own Maps
resources.author: Susan Hansen
resources.rationale: This book provides great examples of different kinds of maps that students will be creating in their geography lessons.
resources.note: Teachers may wish to check this book out from the library rather than purchase it, as it is only used for a couple of lessons.

resources.title: Mama Built a Little Nest
resources.author: Jennifer Ward
resources.maySub: any life-giving picture book preferred by the teacher that is about birds and their different types of nests.
resources.rationale: This beautiful picture book introduces students to the variety of ways that birds build homes for their offspring. It is a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.

resources.title: Mama Lisa's World
resources.author: Mama Lisa
resources.rationale: Free site of folk songs from around the world. Often includes recordings, sheet music, and lyrics (Note: There will be discrepancies among the versions).

resources.title: Man on the Moon: How a Photograph Made Anything Seem Possible
resources.author: Pamela Dell
resources.rationale: A photographic story of the beginning of the space age.

resources.title: Mansa Musa and the Empire of Mali
resources.author: P. James Oliver
resources.rationale: Oliver's well-researched biography of Mansa Musa reads like an exotic tale of gold, glory, and adventure.

resources.title: Manteo's World
resources.author: Helen C. Rountree
resources.rationale: Featuring maps and original illustrations, Rountree offers a much-needed introduction to the history and culture of the region's Native American people before, during, and after the founding of the Roanoke colony.
resources.note: Grades 10 & 11 choose Manteo's World OR The Lost World of the Old Ones. Grade 12 reads both.

resources.title: Maple Moon
resources.author: Connie Brummel Crook
resources.rationale: In _Maple Moon_, Connie Brummel Crook borrows from traditional folk tales to create an enchanting fictional account of how maple syrup might have been discovered. The protagonist, a young Mississauga boy named Rides the Wind, learns of the sweet water because his physical limitations prevent him from joining a hunt; yet, it is this discovery that helps his community survive the winter. Illustrated by beautiful paintings, this book teaches children that strength can come in many forms.

resources.title: Mapping the World with Art
resources.author: Ellen Johnston McHenry
resources.rationale: This book is a blend of history, geography, and art. The text is about the history of cartography, from the earliest maps that were drawn on clay by the people of Mesopotamia to the exploration of the "new world."  This book also includes map drawing lessons that take students step by step through the process of drawing maps of all the countries mentioned in the text.
resources.note: We highly recommend purchasing the videos that guide students through the map drawings. The option linked includes a digital version of the book along with the video course, but you can also purchase the videos in DVD or USB format if you prefer a physical copy of the book. The discount code is valid for all products on the author's site.

resources.title: Marco Polo
resources.author: Manuel Komroff
resources.rationale: The story of a Venetian trader who becomes an aide to the great Kublai Khan comes to life in this retelling for students. This book will provide the context to explore the geographical features of southern Europe, the Middle East, and East Asia as students follow along with the travels of Marco Polo.

resources.title: Marco Polo
resources.author: George Makepeace Towle
resources.rationale: If the task is properly done, no one can fail to follow Marco Polo from his Venetian home, across the entire continent of Asia to the court of Kublai Khan, and in his various adventures and journeys while in the far-off Orient, without eager curiosity and ever-deepening interest. The central figure of the story is heroic, for Marco Polo was in all things manly, brave, persevering, intelligent, and chivalrous; and the scenes and incidents in which he was the leading actor were in the highest degree thrilling and dramatic.

resources.title: Mary Geddy's Day: A Colonial Girl in Williamsburg
resources.author: Kate Waters
resources.rationale: Walk through a typical day with a wealthy Colonial Virginian family.

resources.title: Master of Field Arts
resources.author: Roseann Hanson

discount.text: 25% off your entire purchase excluding workshops/classes

resources.rationale: Welcome to the next level for nature journalers and field sketchers—a deep dive into becoming a dedicated master naturalist and field artist.

resources.title: Mastering Hand Building
resources.author: Sunshine Cobb
resources.rationale: From pinch pots to coiled boxes to soft slab tableware, mastering hand building is a lifelong pursuit. This book covers all the foundational skills, with lessons for constructing both simple and complex forms from clay.

resources.title: Material World: A Global Family Portrait
resources.author: Peter Menzel

resources.title: Math Art and Drawing Games for Kids
resources.author: Karyn Tripp

resources.title: Math Card Games Kit
resources.author: RightStart
resources.maySub: any games that allow students to practice math concepts and skills.
resources.rationale:
Kit is recommended for those who do not use RightStart Math; kit is included in the RS2 Math Set. 
➜  Additional recommended game titles will be listed with the Lesson Plans for each level of mathematics.

resources.title: Me on the Map
resources.author: Joan Sweeney
resources.rationale: This book explains the many ways in which we can describe where we are located. Beginning in a little girl's room, we gradually zoom out to her house, her street, her town, her state, her country, and her planet.

resources.title: Measure of the Earth
resources.author: Larrie Ferreiro
resources.rationale: Travel to colonial South America with scientists and naval officers tasked with measuring a degree of latitude along the equator in order to verify the shape of the earth.

resources.title: Meet George Washington
resources.author: Joan Heilbroner
resources.rationale: This short biography would make good reading practice for children who have finished the reading lessons.

resources.title: Meet Thomas Jefferson
resources.author: Marvin Barrett
resources.rationale: This short biography would make good reading practice for children who have finished the reading lessons.

resources.title: Mesopotamia: The Invention of the City
resources.author: Gwendolyn Leick
resources.rationale: Situated in an area roughly corresponding to present-day Iraq, Mesopotamia is one of the great, ancient civilizations, though it is still relatively unknown. Yet, over 7,000 years ago in Mesopotamia, the very first cities were created. This book brings those people to life.
resources.note: ALERT: Sensitive content. Lesson plans will provide guidance.

resources.title: Messiah
resources.author: Watkins Shaw (editor), George Frideric Handel (composer)
resources.rationale: Music score.

resources.title: Metaphors We Live By
resources.author: George Lakoff & Mark Johnson
resources.rationale: Classic text discussing metaphors which embed ourselves into everyday language and shape the way we think and see the world.

resources.title: Mexico in Your Kitchen
resources.author: Mely Martínez
resources.maySub: a cookbook from any culture that includes both recipes and a narrative illustrating how food connects to the culture
resources.note: Choose this OR Gullah Geechee Home Cooking, Classic Russian Cooking, Pomp and Sustenance, Celtic Folklore Cooking, or a cookbook from another culture of your choosing

resources.title: Michael Faraday's The Chemical History of a Candle
resources.author: Bill Hammack & Don DeCoste
resources.rationale: This book introduces modern readers to Michael Faraday’s great nineteenth-century lectures on "The Chemical History of a Candle." Students will be watching the lectures on video, so this text is for teachers or for students who would like to follow along using the text.

resources.title: Micro Life
resources.author: DK/Smithsonian Institution
resources.rationale: An amazing close-up look at all aspects of micro life!
resources.note: Choose this book OR Microbe Hunters

resources.title: Microbe Hunters
resources.author: Paul De Kruif
resources.rationale: Fascinating biographies of famous scientists.
resources.note:
Choose this book OR A Planet of Viruses, Trees Up Close, & Growing a Revolution.

Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting, Audible, and Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Migrant Mother: How a Photograph Defined the Great Depression
resources.author: Don Nardo
resources.rationale: Dorothea Lange documents the American Great Depression in the 1930s.

resources.title: Miles to Go For Freedom: Segregation and Civil Rights in the Jim Crow Years
resources.author: Linda Osborne
resources.rationale:
Through first-person accounts and primary sources, this book gives an account of segregation
 and civil rights through a discussion of the different laws that were passed between 1890-1954.

resources.title: Mini-Farming: Self-Sufficiency on 1/4 Acre
resources.author: Brett Markham
resources.rationale: This resource is for the more seasoned gardener who is interested in self-sufficiency and conservation.

resources.title: Mirror Mirror: A Book of Reverso Poems
resources.author: Marilyn Singer

resources.title: Mission to Pluto: The First Visit to an Ice Dwarf and the Kuiper Belt
resources.author: Mary Kay Carson
resources.rationale: Students learn about the discovery of Pluto and join the scientists who are learning about our solar system. How do we learn about very big things and those that are very far away? We find out on a Mission to Pluto!
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting.

resources.title: Mix It Up!
resources.author: Herve Tullet
resources.rationale: Talks about mixing colors. Interactive.

resources.title: Monarch and Milkweed
resources.author: Helen Frost
resources.maySub: any life-giving picture book preferred by the teacher that is about an insect within the context of its plant community.
resources.rationale: This beautiful picture book introduces students to an insect and its relationship with the environment. It is a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.

resources.title: Moonstick: The Seasons of the Sioux
resources.author: Eve Bunting
resources.rationale: A young boy comes of age under the thirteen moons of the Sioux year. With each notch in his father's moon-counting stick, the boy marvels at the world around him, observing the sometimes subtle, sometimes remarkable, changes in the seasons and in his own tribe's way of living.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

resources.title: More Stories of Composers for Young Musicians
resources.author: Catherine Wolff

resources.title: Moses: When Harriet Tubman Led Her People to Freedom
resources.author: Carole Boston Weatherford
resources.rationale: This beautifully illustrated book shows the fear, the determination, and the reliance upon God demonstrated by one of the most famous conductors on the Underground Railroad.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Much Ado About Nothing
resources.author: William Shakespeare
resources.rationale: One of Shakespeare's most famous comedies, this play is set in Messina, Italy, and follows two interwoven romantic plots filled with wit, deception, and misunderstandings.

resources.title: Much Ado About Nothing (Audio recording)
resources.author: Arkangel
resources.maySub: Librivox recording

resources.title: Muhammad and the Believers: At the Origins of Islam
resources.author: Fred Donner

resources.title: Musical Instruments of the World: An Illustrated Encyclopedia with more than 4000 original drawings
resources.author: The Diagram Group
resources.rationale: Great for book of centuries and history charts.

resources.title: My Brother Sam Is Dead
resources.author: James Lincoln Collier
resources.maySub: Johnny Tremain (see Grades 5-6 booklist) if students are likely to struggle with the more challenging content and a few violent and disturbing scenes in My Brother Sam is Dead.
resources.rationale: This riveting and sobering story introduces students to Tim Meeker, whose brother Sam enlists in the American Army and whose father supports the British. Based on real events and people, the narrative helps students struggle with the complexity of the American Revolution and it's cost and necessity.

resources.title: My Canada: An Illustrated Atlas
resources.author: Katherine Dearlove
resources.rationale: A visually appealing atlas for young learners, this fun book makes a good companion to studying the provinces in _The Kids Book of Canada_.

resources.title: My Daily Pursuit: Devotions for Everyday
resources.author: A. W. Tozer
resources.rationale: Devotional Literature

resources.title: My Dearest Friend: Letters of Abigail and John Adams
resources.author: John & Abigail Adams
resources.rationale: Delightful source documents that illuminate the lives of Abigail and John Adams.

resources.title: My Indian
resources.author: Saqamaw Mi'sel Joe and Sheila O'Neill
resources.rationale: _My Indian_ is a historical reimagining of a journey through Newfoundland that actually took place in 1822. William Cormack, an explorer and writer born in Newfoundland to Scottish parents, endeavoured to discover the last remaining Beothuk people, and requested the assistance of a Mi’kmaw guide, Sylvester Joe, whom he referred to as "My Indian" in his journals. This book recounts this journey from the perspective of Sylvester Joe, and includes engaging details about Mi'kmaq culture, history, and traditions. It also raises important issues about naming, identity, and respect.

resources.title: Mystery & Manners
resources.author: Flannery O'Connor
resources.rationale: Thoughts on writing by one of America's famous authors.

resources.title: Napoleon
resources.author: David A. Bell
resources.rationale: Very readable biography of this important historical figure.

resources.title: Narration Notecards - Stories of the Nations Vol.2
resources.author: Crystal Lee Hildreth
resources.rationale: This set contains excellent narration prompts for children of various ages and levels. Assignments in our lesson plans will often refer you to them.

resources.title: National Geographic Book of Animal Poetry
resources.author: J. Patrick Lewis
resources.rationale: Lovingly selected by U.S. Children's Poet Laureate J. Patrick Lewis and paired with vibrant animal photography, this collection of poems is a beautiful and fun introduction to many different poets and poems.

resources.title: National Parks of Canada Colouring Book
resources.author: Leor Boshi

resources.title: Nature All Around: Plants
resources.author: Pamela Hickman
resources.rationale: We have chosen this lovely companion to our picture book selection for our 5th graders' introduction to botany. This title uses simple language, introduces new terms, and incorporates artwork that is both beautiful and useful for students who are ready to get to know the world of plants more closely!

resources.title: Nature Journaling for a Wild Life
resources.author: Roseann Beggy Hanson
resources.rationale: Explore the enriching world of nature journaling in an eight-week, self-guided “workshop in a book” from explorer, naturalist, and artist Roseann Hanson.

resources.title: Nature's Friend: The Gwen Frostic Story
resources.author: Lindsey McDivitt

resources.title: Nearer My Freedom: The Interesting Life of Olaudah Equiano by Himself
resources.author: Monica Edinger & Lesley Younge
resources.rationale: _Nearer My Freedom_ retells Equiano’s remarkable life story in found verse, shaping his own words into striking and accessible poetry. Supplemented with detailed and illuminating annotations, authors Monica Edinger and Lesley Younge offer a fresh means to engage with one of the most famous texts of the abolition movement.

resources.title: New City Catechism
resources.author: Timothy J. Keller
resources.maySub: Resource from your own faith tradition.
resources.rationale: This short book lays out 52 questions and answers related to God, human nature, sin, Christ, the Holy Spirit, and more. Whether used devotionally, recited orally, or memorized over the course of a year, families, churches, small groups, and Christian schools will treasure this as a valuable tool for teaching the core doctrines of the Christian faith to children and adults alike.

resources.title: Next Time You See a Cloud
resources.author: Emily Morgan
resources.rationale: This beautiful picture book calls attention to physical features in the larger ecosystem: weather changes and the movement of water. It is a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.

resources.title: NG Kids National Parks Guide USA Centennial Edition
resources.author: National Geographic Kids

resources.title: Nine Day Queen of England: Lady Jane Grey
resources.author: Faith Cook
resources.rationale: This book gives historical context to the biography of Lady Jane Grey, the woman who was Queen of England for nine days before being executed because of her faith. Lady Jane’s education, biblical training, and intelligence show how this young woman of sixteen could understand and hold firm to her beliefs even in the face of death.
resources.note: Choose ONE of the biographies listed for Term 3.

resources.title: Nitty-Gritty Grammar
resources.author: Edith Fine & Judith Josephson
resources.rationale: Can be used by the teacher as a quick reference to look up rules on grammar, punctuation, and usage as questions arise. Not for student use.

resources.title: NIV Cultural Backgrounds Study Bible: Bringing to Life the Ancient World of Scripture
resources.author: Zondervan
resources.maySub: a translation of your choice.
resources.rationale: Contains unabridged Scripture along with important archaeological, historical, and cultural background.
resources.note: This resource is for Grades 9+ ONLY. Grades 7-8 should use the ESV Concise Study Bible.

resources.title: North American Cambridge Latin Unit 1 5th Ed. Student Book
resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: This program continues presenting narrative stories in Latin, grammar exercises, vocabulary, and historical notes in an engaging way.

resources.title: North American Cambridge Latin Unit 2 5th Ed. Student Book
resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: Contains comic strips and narrative stories in Latin, grammar exercises, vocabulary, and historical notes.

resources.title: North American Cambridge Latin Unit 2 5th Ed. Student Book Answer Key
resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: Contains answers to selected exercises in the Student Book.
resources.note: The answer key is not needed if using Elevate OR the Alveary Online course.

resources.title: North American Cambridge Latin Unit 2 5th Ed. Teacher's Manual (Digital)
resources.author: Cambridge School Classics Project
resources.rationale: Contains important teaching tips for successful implementation.
resources.note: Not needed if using Alveary Online Course. Please call the Cambridge University Press Customer Service team at 1-800-872-7423 (toll-free). or email them at orders@cambridge.org to purchase a digital copy.

resources.title: North American Cambridge Latin Unit 3 5th Ed.
resources.rationale: This is the student book and contains comic strips and narrative stories in Latin, grammar exercises, vocabulary, and historical notes.
resources.note: This edition comes with 1-year access to Elevate/Cambridge Go.

resources.title: North American Indian
resources.author: David Murdoch
resources.rationale: Children will enjoy looking at pictures of Native American artifacts as they read about the many diverse tribes.

resources.title: North: the Amazing Story of Arctic Migration
resources.author: Nick Dowson
resources.rationale: This beautiful picture book introduces students to animal migration as a global phenomenon.  It is a lovely addition to your bookshelf, but scheduling in the lesson plans is flexible for those using their library.

resources.title: Northanger Abbey (and others by Jane Austen)
resources.author: Jane Austen
resources.rationale:
Explore any of Jane Austen's novels for fun!

Movie suggestions: 
Pride & Prejudice (1995)
Emma (2009)
Sense & Sensibility (1995 or 2008)

resources.title: Number Stories of Long Ago
resources.author: David Smith
resources.maySub: another edition, but page numbers will be different
resources.rationale: This is the story of how mathematics developed out of the early need for humans to have a language for "how many" and evolved into the robust system of arithmetic we know today.

resources.title: Nutrition Facts for Kids: Teaching Children The Facts About Nutrition
resources.author: Maryse A. Rouffaer

resources.title: Oaxaca Journal

resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting.

resources.title: Of Arms and Artists: The American Revolution through Painters' Eyes
Of Arms and Artists: The American Revolution through Painters' Eyes
resources.author: Paul Staiti

resources.title: Old Testament Today
resources.author: John H. Walton & Andrew E. Hill
resources.rationale: It is so important for students to understand the context in which the Bible was written and what it meant to the original audience. However, it is also important to understand how the OT writings are relevant to us today. The authors do a wonderful job communicating all these ideas. Lesson plans will guide you in navigating this rich text.
resources.note: Students will use this book for several years as they read through the OT.

resources.title: On the Shores of the Great Sea
resources.author: M. B. Synge

resources.title: On the Trapline
resources.author: David A. Robertson
resources.rationale: _On the Trapline_ is an award-winning picture book, which tells the gentle story of a boy accompanying his grandfather on a trip back to his childhood home where he and his family lived off the land.

resources.title: On Writing Well: The Classic Guide to Writing Nonfiction
resources.author: William Zinsser
resources.rationale: Dive deeper into the world of nonfiction writing with Zinsser's classic text.

resources.title: Once Upon a Rock: Plate Tectonics and the Story of Life

resources.author: Dolores Johnson

resources.title: Ourselves Book 2: Self-Direction
resources.author: Charlotte Mason
resources.maySub: any edition.
resources.rationale: Mason emphasized that children are persons; this is the volume in which she defines that term. What characteristics do we, as Image-Bearers, have in common? What kinds of pitfalls should we anticipate? These are some of the profound questions Mason deals with in this, her only volume written directly to students.

resources.author: M Swannell and Brittney McGann

resources.author: Ednah Rich
resources.rationale: This book begins with very simple models; difficulty increases gradually.
resources.note: Be sure to purchase the Yesterday's Classics edition, as other editions have issues with formatting and readability. Video tutorials are provided with lesson plans.

resources.title: Paradise Lost
resources.author: John Milton
resources.rationale: A beautiful and famous work of literature from the early part of our historical time period. Working within the epic genre, Milton poetically retells and reflects on the Genesis account of the Fall.
resources.note: We recommend the Modern Library version because of it's helpful annotations and extra commentary.

resources.title: Paradise Lost: Legacy Edition
resources.author: John Milton; ed. by Lauren Ducommun
resources.rationale: Our _Legacy Edition_ is unabridged and has spelling that has been lightly updated in cases where it would confuse modern readers. Explanatory notes are included in the margins for allusions to Greek mythology and obscure words.

resources.title: Paragraph Town
resources.author: Michael Clay Thompson
resources.rationale: This program brings story, delight, and ideas to the study of grammar. _Paragraph Town_ gives children an entertaining and comprehensive introduction to the paragraph. With a narrative background, students explore the importance of organizing sentences into clear, orderly paragraphs with dialogue, description, comparison, punctuation, and grammar, as well as a look at the significance of the sounds of language. Structured exercises and assignments allow students to practice integrating these ideas into their writing.

resources.title: Parliament: Canada's Democracy and How It Works
resources.author: Maureen McTeer
resources.rationale: McTeer provides a friendly insider's view of the life of Parliament. She guides students through the physical spaces, the positions and parties in Parliament, and takes students through the electoral process. Throughout the book she leans on her own experience as a candidate and wife of a prime minister.

resources.title: Parthenon
resources.author: Lynn Curlee
resources.rationale: Explore the history behind one of the most recognizable buildings in the world.

resources.title: Pascal & Fermat
resources.author: Robert Black
resources.rationale:
In the early 1650s, a French aristocrat posed a gambling question to Blaise Pascal, one of the most brilliant scientists and philosophers of the time. But even Pascal needed help. The idea of seeing the future—even seeing a possible future—was so alien that he needed to discuss it with someone else. So he contacted his countryman Pierre de Fermat, arguably the greatest “amateur” mathematician of all time. Over several months, the two men exchanged a series of letters that laid the foundation of what we know today as probability theory. 
There’s a “Doing the Math” section at the end of the book so that students can try working out the math themselves! This is a shorter read than some of the other options for Term 3.
resources.note: Choose ONE of the biographies listed for term 3.

resources.title: Patterns in Plants Card Game
resources.author: Hops Press
resources.rationale: A helpful addition to _Botany in a Day_ for learning the plant families.

resources.title: Peeps at Many Lands: Ancient Greece
resources.author: James Baikie

resources.title: Peeps at Many Lands: Ancient Rome
resources.author: James Baikie

resources.title: Peggy and Hamilton!: A Revolutionary Friendship
resources.author: L. M. Elliott
resources.rationale: **Drawing from historical journals and letters, _New York Times _bestselling author Laura Elliot weaves a richly detailed tale about the extraordinary Peggy Schuyler and her revolutionary friendship with Alexander Hamilton. **

resources.title: Pensées
resources.author: Blaise Pascal
resources.maySub: Free version online
resources.rationale: The _Penseés_ is a collection of philosophical fragments, notes and essays in which Pascal, a theologian and mathematician, explores the nature of God, man, and the universe. Read alongside Descartes and other essays in the lesson plans.
resources.note: Students only read selections of the Penseés, so you may wish to access a free version online.

resources.title: People of the Breaking Day
resources.author: Marcia Sewall
resources.rationale: Marcia Sewall recreates the world of the Wampanoags, the People of the Breaking Day. In a voice that evokes the pride and natural poetry of these native people and in paintings glowing with life and light, the distinguished author-illustrator presents another view of an important time in American history, a time before the meeting of two very different cultures.

resources.title: Periodic Table of Elements 1000 Piece Puzzle

resources.title: Phineas Gage
resources.author: John Fleischman
resources.rationale: In this classic story, readers hear the story of a man who suffers an horrific railroad accident.  The resulting brain injury forever changes his life and produces one the most fascinating case studies that neuroscience has ever seen. Note that the author associates social ability and success with human value. Discuss with students as appropriate.
resources.note: Available on Kindle with enhanced typesetting and Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.title: Pilgrim's Progress: Updated, Modern English
resources.author: John Bunyan
resources.maySub: original text.
resources.rationale: Mason's students read the original text, and some Alveary members choose to do the same. However, we find this retelling robust and beautiful, without the archaic vocabulary of the original, making the ideas more accessible to young children.
resources.note: Grade 3: Students should read EITHER Pilgrim's Progress OR A Wonder Book.

resources.title: Pink and Say
resources.author: Patricia Polacco
resources.rationale:
An unlikely friendship is born when a wounded Union soldier is found and given care in
Confederate territory. But his presence puts everyone around him in danger.
resources.note: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

resources.rationale: Austen's most popular novel which she began writing at just 19! The unforgettable story of Elizabeth Bennett, Mr. Darcy, and their friends and family. Also a memorable tale about the trustworthiness of "first impressions," which was the original title of the book.

resources.title: Pyramid
resources.author: David Macaulay
resources.rationale: This book gives students an opportunity to learn more about ancient Egyptian civilization, history, and architecture as the author illustrates and recounts detail by detail, how the great pharaohs' burial places were conceived and constructed.

resources.title: Queen Eleanor: Independent Spirit of the Medieval World
resources.author: Polly Schoyer Brooks
resources.rationale: Born in 1122, Eleanor refused to be confined by the traditional gender roles of her time. She became well educated, gaining political and governing know-how from her father, William X, Duke of Aquitaine, and armed herself with the skills necessary to become an influential queen-first of France, and later, England. With an impact that reached beyond politics, Eleanor shaped the future of the arts and humanities.

resources.title: Quillworker: A Cheyenne Legend
resources.author: Terri Cohlene
resources.rationale: This legend tells about the origin of stars.

resources.title: Rachel Ruysch: Nature into Art
resources.author: Schindler, Ebert & Knaap
resources.rationale: This is the only known book resource on Ruysch and was recently released. The images are full pages and beautiful replications.

resources.title: Ramona Quimby series
resources.author: Beverly Cleary
resources.rationale: The series concentrates on Ramona from nursery school to 4th grade, touching on social issues such as a parent losing their job, financial instability, the death of a family pet, school bullies, divorce, marriage, sibling relations and experiencing the addition of a new sibling, and more, all of which explore growing up in middle-class America.

resources.title: Raven: A Trickster Tale From the Pacific Northwest
resources.author: Gerald McDermott
resources.rationale: Raven, the trickster, wants to give people the gift of light. But can he find out where Sky Chief keeps it? And if he does, will he be able to escape without being discovered? His dream seems impossible, but if anyone can find a way to bring light to the world, wise and clever Raven can!

resources.title: Reaching for the Moon

resources.rationale: Buzz Aldrin recounts his childhood and the events that led to the landing on the moon.

resources.title: Reading Lessons: Level 1 (Revised 2025)
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This program features 15-minute lessons focused on phonics and high-frequency word recognition using classic stories and poems. Includes spelling, copywork, dictation, and some grammar. Lessons are newly revised to reflect recent research, especially the importance of phonological awareness and phonics. The additional instruction is blended into the current lessons from the Free and Treadwell Readers.
resources.note: Also available in Grade 1 Bundle with Alveary printing store.

resources.title: Reading Lessons: Level 2 (Revised 2025)
resources.author: Alveary
resources.rationale: This program features 15-minute lessons focusing on phonics and high-frequency word recognition and utilizing classic stories and poems. Includes spelling, copywork, dictation, and some grammar. Lessons are newly revised for this year to reflect recent research, especially the importance of phonological awareness and phonics. The additional instruction is blended into the current lessons from the Free and Treadwell Readers.

resources.title: Reading Lessons: Level 3
